JOB DESCRIPTION Ø Graduate of any Four (4) years course Ø With certificates of BOSH, COSH, LCM, First Aid, Scaffold and Gondola Ø With at least 1-2 years’ experience as a Safety Officer Ø Willing to work during Sundays, Holidays and extend working hours Ø With good communication and interpersonal skills Ø Willing to assign in different locations/Area RESPONSIBILITIES Ø Observed and complies with existing company codes, policies, agreements and rules and regulation Ø Supervises the regular inspection of building, facilities, work areas, tools and equipment in the project site including observance of work procedures and methods of employees to determine unsafe working conditions and practices Ø Initiates investigation and/or analysis of circumstances behind any accident resulting to damage or injury to company property or person through spot and interrogation of parties and/or witness involved in determining cause and recurrence of same Ø Supervise proper housekeeping and cleaning of the work area including tools and equipment, materials, etc. Ø Observe and enforces safety rules and regulation in the work area Ø Secure working permit prior to start the work activities Ø Conducts daily Toolbox Meeting Ø Carry out pre-inspection of equipment’s and complete daily checklist prior to start the work Ø Conduct Incident/Accident investigations, analyze and formulate recommendations for corrective and preventive actions Ø Conduct safety surveillance of ongoing work activities and immediate action shall be carried out to safety non-conformance Ø Perform other tasks that may be assigned from time to time

Company: Antz Insurance Agency and Services Inc
Job Description: Job Description Responsible for planning, implementing, and overseeing the company's employee safety at work and ensures that the company is in compliance and adheres to Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) guidelines. RESPONSIBILITIES: Plan and implement OHS policies and programs. Facilitates compliance with Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) guidelines. Ensures a safe working environment to prevent any injuries and accidents Assist government inspectors in the conduct of safety and health inspection at any time whenever work is being performed or during the conduct of an accident investigation by providing necessary information and OSH reports as required by the OSH standards Coordinates with Company Nurse and monitors the health checklist forms daily and ensures compliance with COVID-19 safety protocols Prepares and submits reportorial to DOLE and other related government agency Carrying out risk assessments and considering how risks could be reduced Leads in-house training with employees on health and safety issues and risks Keeps records of inspections findings and producing reports that suggest improvements; incidents and accidents and produce statistics for HR Head Acts as a chairman of the safety and safety committee QUALIFICATIONS: Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering or Medical courses or any equivalent. Completed the 40-hour Basic Occupational Safety and Health Training Course Completed the additional 48 hours of advanced/ specialized OSH training course Preferably Safety Officer 3 practitioner With at least 3 years safety practitioner experience in Knowledgeable in writing reports and policies related to health, environmental and safety concerns and issues Proficient in MS Office; working knowledge of safety management information systems is a plus Outstanding organizational skills Diligent with great attention to details

Applicant must be knowledgeable on field hydrology, specifically on surface water hydrology. Applicant must be knowledgeable on hydrologic frequency analysis. Applicant must be able to do actual flow measurements in river and streams. Applicant must be able to assess, evaluate, and recommend existing and potential water sources. Job Description Identify and evaluate existing potential water sources for domestic water supply. Conduct stream flow monitoring activities to assess the sustainablity of rivers and streams. Conduct field visits and investigations to determine possible source of potable water. Provide water resource assessment studies and other hydrology-related studies.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: - enforce safety policies - develop health and safety programs/procedures - facilitate and review job hazard analysis (JHA) - conduct audits and inspections - lead safety audits together with committee - manage external audit (i.e. BFP inspections, building inspections) - manage safety devices - conduct accident/incident investigation - facilitate corrective and preventive actions - report submission - ensure compliance to national and local safety regulations - employee training - ensure mandatory training compliance (internal and external) - JHA training - environmental and waste monitoring - waste management and disposal - report submission/compliance to regulatories - safety meeting - lead the plant monthly safety committee meeting - attend corporate safety meeting - initiate safety meeting as necessary - plant security - manage security personnel - ensure functionality of security devices - perform as Pollution Control Officer (PCO) PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Graduate of any Engineering course Has around 3-5 years relevant experience Strong analytical and planning skills; Good communication and presentation skills; Excellent problem-solving skills; Must have strong relevant background in HSE implementation and management Preferably with Pollution Control experience Willing to work in Porac, Pampanga.

Prepares and submits reportorial to DOLE and other related government agency. Coordinates with Company Nurse and monitors the health checklist forms daily and ensures compliance with COVID-19 safety protocols. Plan and implement OHS policies and programs. Carrying out risk assessments and considering how risks could be reduced. Plan and implement OHS policies and programs. Keeps records of inspections findings and producing reports that suggest improvements; incidents and accidents and produce statistics for HR. Leads in-house training with employees on health and safety issues and risks.

Duties & Responsibilities: Check operation facilities, reduce the degree of risks and breakdowns, and develop strategies to improve over all safety of the company premises, personnel and operation process. Implements safety rules and performs counter measure against accidents Process and coordinate with concerned department/personnel in preparing and processing of government (DENR, DOLE, etc.) permits for compliance submission Prepares incident reports, man hours, and accident reports; prepares job hazard analysis Ensures that all safety devices in the building are well maintained and are in good operating conditions such as fire extinguishers, etc. Ensure safe working environment and compliance in wearing PPEs Qualifications: Candidate must possess a College/ Bachelor's Degree Accomplished related Safety or Pollution Control Trainings and Seminars With at least 3 years of relevant work experience from a Manufacturing Company Strong analytical, problem-solving and conceptual skills. Ability to multi task and can handle pressures and deadlines. Willing to work in Meycauayan City, Bulacan

JOB SUMMARY & PURPOSE This role is primarily responsible in creating, enacting, and updating job safety programmes for employees that encompass government health and safety regulations as well as company standards for safety in the workplace. Training employees on the importance of health and safety on the job. III. DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES A. Key Accountability: SAFETY 1)	Develops and implements measures to ensure personnel safety. 2)	Conducts regular inspections to ensure a hazard-free and safe working environment. 3)	Develops, improves and implements Safety and Health standards, policies, plans and programs. 4)	Develop and implement a system to regularly monitor and assess hazardous and unsafe situations. 5)	Corrects unsafe acts or conditions through the regular line of authority and proper policy. 6)	Exercise emergency authority to prevent or stop unsafe acts when immediate action is required. 7)	Maintains awareness of active and developing situations. 8)	Inspects and certifies that all tools and equipment are adequate and safe for use. 9)	Investigates accidents that have occurred within incident areas, together with the appropriate Incident Investigation Team. 10)	Ensures that injury logs and reports are completed and submitted to related government agencies. 11)	Monitors and facilitates arrangements for mandated testing and/or evaluations of the workplace. 12)	Plan, Develop and Implements the continuous education program of employees on Safety and Health. 13)	Responds to employees’ safety concerns. 14)	Participates in planning meetings to identify any health and safety concerns inherent in the operations daily work-plan. 15)	Participates in continuing education to ensure update of knowledge on Safety and Health protocols and techniques. B. Key Accountability: GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES 1)	Perform proper and complete documentation of all transactions / activities. 2)	Prepare, analyze, submit necessary profiling, monitoring and reportorial requirements. 3)	Maintain a comprehensive physical and electronic filing system. 4)	Assist in the implementation of any / all Company initiatives, activities / programs. 5)	Initiate and/or contribute to the continuous improvement of any Company policy and procedure. 6)	Perform other functions as required. C. Key Accountability: GENERAL MANAGERIAL 1)	Develop annual goals and action plans to fully support organizational goals, plans and strategies. 2)	Participate in the development of the Strategic and Business Plans. 3)	Recommend changes in the operating policies and procedures that will result in process improvements, increased efficiencies, optimal delivery of resources, determine resource requirements and budget proposals. 4)	Align and cascade organization performance indicators to team and individual performance indicators. 5)	Assess effectiveness of organizational set-up (organizational structure, reporting relationships, assignment of responsibilities), organization culture, effectiveness of working relationships of next level heads. 6)	Communicate corporate thrusts, directions and plans to next level management and enforce the company code on employee discipline. 7)	Secure the commitment of direct reports and working teams in the achievement of organizational targets, goals and plans. 8)	Manage team performance through motivation, coaching and supervisor mentoring. 9)	Evaluate performance and provide reward and recognition for individual/team performance. 10)	Assess employee performance and implements corrective measures for improved goal attainment. 11)	Identify and initiate career development programs and individual performance plans for the management hierarchy and ensure that these programs are implemented. 12)	Monitor and evaluate performance of the organization through the development of organizational performance measures cascaded from overall strategic plans, with corresponding improvement plans. 13)	Formulate and implement measures to address the Goals and Action Plans and facilitate the achievement of targets. 14)	Provide leadership in the development of the budget & controlling expenditure within the approved budget. 15)	Provide leadership & oversee the daily operations of the group. D. Key Accountability: SAFETY, HEALTH & ENVIRONMENT 1)	Ensures participation to Company risk identification, assessment, and management program. 2)	Ensures participation to Company SHES induction upon on boarding and on succeeding SHES refresher training. 3)	Reports safety, health, environment, and security issues to immediate superior in a timely manner. 4)	Follows safe work procedures and conducts tasks which utilize optimum energy and resources, thus keeping wastes into minimum and prevents pollution. 5)	Maintains good housekeeping and good hygiene to establish a safe and conducive workplace. 6)	Maintains and keeps self-healthy. Does not report to work having communicable and contagious illness. Keeps the occupational health unit informed of any communicable and contagious illness. 7)	Ensures availability to subject self to annual medical and physical checks sponsored by the Company. 8)	Conducts safety inspections according to Company safety walk-through program. 9)	Stops any work and activity within the facility, if eminent danger is observed. Facilitates reporting the action to immediate superior for proper information dissemination and corrective actions. IV. JOB REQUIREMENTS : 1)	Education: College graduate 2)	Experience: at least two (2) years from related field/function, preferably SO3 level 3)	License/ Certification Required: BOSH, OSH Training 4) Willing to be assigned Madaum, Tagum City and occasional travel to Trento, Agusan del Sur 5) Proficient with the use of Microsoft Office, social media applications 6) Creative and quick to respond 7) Physically & mentally fit V. OTHER SKILLS & COMPETENCIES: 1)	Strong community organizing skills, initiating group gatherings and information drives 2)	Strong public relations and presentation skills 3)	Efficient in project management handling projects and initiatives 4)	Excellent communication skills in forming partner relationships with internal and external stakeholders 5)	Knowledge in Power Point presentations and data processing programs

Job requirements Graduate of Industrial Engineering or any Engineering Course With at least 1 year of related experience With complete training on Basic Occupational Health and Safety (BOHS) With experience on the compliance of legal and other regulatory requirements Proficient in the use of MS Office Application Knowledge in ISO Documentation Data gathering and interpretation Good communication skills (written and verbal) Knowledgeable in Risk assessment

JOB QUALIFICATIONS: Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering (Environmental/Health/Safety) or equivalent. At least 5 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Preferably Assistant Manager/Manager specialized in Engineering - Environmental/Health/Safety or equivalent. Must be an Accredited Safety Practitioner/Consultant. 5 yrs. experience as Safety Officer with exposure in First and procedure knowledge in the preparation and implementation of international safety standards and procedures, can conduct safety training with 3 years experience in occupational health and safety in construction industry. Must be aggressive and result oriented. Computer literate; Excellent both in oral & written communication skills. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Prepares accident and loss prevention program and administers its implementation. Stops any operation or action, which is judged an imminent hazard until the hazardous condition or procedures are remedied. Serve as a liaison, local and private agencies on matters pertaining to Industrial or construction safety and hygiene. Prepares and keep adequate records of all accidents; prepares monthly accident statistics to show data on frequency and severity rates. Conducts independent safety audit to check conformance with the established safety program and draw management attention to any defect or deficiency. Keeps abreast with new development in the field of accident prevention, PPE and first aid procedures. Promotes safety through publications, poster, awards and incentive programs, etc. Administers the security of project sites against pilferage and thefts. Prepares quality take-off and budgetary cost of safety, health, environment and security requirements during project bids. Prepares needed documents concerning health and safety during pre-qualification process for submission to prospective projects

Job Title: Baguio Customer Agents | With Relocation Package & HMO | Retail Account
Job Description: Who Are We Looking For? • Someone who can WOW CUSTOMERS over the phone, online chat, or email • An enthusiastic individual that can BE BOLD with great customer service skills • With a WORK TOGETHER approach with open communication, excellence in service, integrity, and accountability • Has the ability to BUILD TRUST by working as a team member, as well as independently, with minimal supervision • At least 6 months work experience (any industry) for applicants who finished at least 60 units in college. • College graduates with/without experience • At least 1 year work experience for SHS graduates Perks of Being Part of Us • Paid training from day one • One of the best HMO packages for you and three (3) more dependents • Tons of growth opportunity (93% of our non-agent positions are filled internally) • Access to some pretty cool tools and resources • Ongoing training designed to improve customer experience and business performance • Walk ins are welcome • Medicine Reimbursement • Free Parking • Free Shuttle • Transportation Allowance • Food Allowance • Shuttle pick up for applicants within Baguio going to our site Applicant Referral Program • You can refer your friends and love ones to apply here by sending them the link below and earn P4,000 for each hire! https://bit.ly/2ON7WZ5

RESPONSIBILITIES: Plan and implement OHS policies and programsAdvise and lead employees on various safety-related topicsPrepare educational seminars and webinarsReview existing policies and proceduresConduct risk assessment and enforce preventative measuresIdentify process bottlenecks and offer timely solutionsCheck if all the employees are acting in adherence with the rules and regulationsPrepare and present reports on accidents and violations and determine causesOversee workplace repair, installations and any other work that could harm employees' safety BENEFITS: FREE pre-employment medical examComplete government-mandated benefitsPaid overtime

• With at least 1-4 years of experience in performing Environmental Health and Safety preferably coming from manufacturing environment . • Certificate in Basic Occupational Safety and Health training . • Experience in ISO-Certified company is an advantage.

Overview: The HSE Officer is responsible for ensuring the requirements for Training, Employee Awareness, Event Management and Communication Programs are coordinated appropriately for the business with a focus on Industry Best Practice and that compliance with legislation is achieved. Development of training modules and report preparation is also required for this role. Assessment of OSH Training ang Development needs of employees. Create training modules based on business requirements Plans and facilitates internal training programs Do necessary analysis of training documentation such as but not limited to training effectiveness and training attendance. Support and assist supervisor and line management to identify and coordinate safety awareness training requirements. Maintain high level of on-site safety awareness through the delivery of effective educational and training programmes. Facilitate relevant Safety Induction to visitors, contractors and new employees to ensure that all are aware of their obligations. Monitor the internal reporting of safety incidents and near misses, to ensure that those required to be investigated are completed within appropriate timeframes. Lead investigations, as requested by the Compliance Manager Investigate breaches of safety regulations and produce appropriate reports as required by the Company, regulatory and client procedures. Ensure that shop floors are visited and inspected for safety deficiencies on a regular basis. Conduct safety audits. Report all critical findings immediately to respective area managers. Maintain adequate documentation. Review and make recommendations as necessary how issues should be resolved. Apply risk management principles to initiate new ideas and solutions to control potential risk. Support and assist supervisor and line management to develop Safety Management Plans, as required. Arrange SHECOM meetings and prepare meeting minutes. Prepare toolbox topics and distribute accordingly. Prepare monthly metrics and submit to the Compliance Manager. Develop and implement procedures for effective data management. Manage all incoming data files and comply with retention policy. Analyse statistics and other data. Ability to interpret and evaluate results, and create reports and/or presentations. Monitor and provide metrics of HSE performance and consolidate analysis. Qualifications: The individual must have completed the 40-hour Basic Occupational Safety and Health prescribed by the Bureau (DOLE) or Construction Safety Training (CST) Must have at least three (3) years of relevant experience in Occupational Safety and Health in shipbuilding industry or similar setting. Preferably an Engineering Graduate or equivalent experience. At least a certified First Aider (attended First Aid Training conducted by Red Cross) Ability to maintain a professional composure and keep an objective frame of mind when dealing with serious or catastrophic injuries. Understands community responders (police, fire, etc) organizational structure and can work within that structure during an event of emergency

Job Description: Tasked to implement occupational safety and health programs in the workplace in accordance with the provisions of the standards Act as the employer’s principal assistant and consultant in the application of program to remove the hazards from the workplace and to correct unsafe work practices Serves as Secretary to the Health and Safety Committee. As such, he/she shall: a. prepare minutes of meetings b. report status of recommendations made; c. notify members of the meetings and d. Submit to the employer a report of the facilities of the committee, including recommendations made. Acts in a advisory capacity on all matters pertaining to health and safety for the guidance of the employer and the workers. Conducts investigation of accidents as member of the Health and Safety Committee and submits his separate report and analysis of accidents to the employer. Coordinates all health and safety training programs for the employees and employer. Conducts health and safety inspection as member of the committee. Maintains or helps in the maintenance of an efficient accident record system and coordinates actions taken by supervisors to eliminate accident causes. Provides assistance to government agencies in the conduct of safety and health inspection, accident investigation or any other related programs. Requirements: MUST be BOSH Certified Willing to be assigned either at Parañaque or Alabang

JOB DESCRIPTIONS: Identification and mitigation of potential health and safety hazards and implementation of programs to ensure compliance with environmental regulations. Risk assessment of emergencies (before and after the occurrence of an emergency) as indicated in the Emergency Preparedness and Response (EPR) Manual. Liaising with government agencies on environmental compliance issues, fire safety and the like. Attending meetings for PCO which may be called from time to time by the DENR-EMB and enhance coordination between and among PCO’s in the region. Providing technical consultation with different departments regarding safety/environmental regulations. Recommending to management the installation and operation of additional devices and facility and implementation of other measures for pollution abatement when necessary. Coordination with the different operational departments in the maintenance of health and safety in their area of responsibilities. Monitoring and maintaining all fire extinguishers in use all over the Plant. Preparation and monitoring of activities such as health and safety, emergency preparedness and fire safety trainings and drills including evaluation of its effectiveness; orientation/reorientation; inspection and audits. Planning, preparation, monitoring and evaluation of implemented company’s health and safety policies and programs to ensure safety of workers and environmental requirements to prevent accident in all aspects or operations in the company. Monitoring, reviewing and updating of the EPR Manual and its reportorial requirements.. Monitoring, reviewing and updating of the List of Quality and Environmental Regulations and Evaluation Compliance and ensuring that all conditions under each permits are well evaluated on a regular basis. Reviewing, updating and evaluating of the required and current competency levels of the Emergency Response Team. Monitoring company compliance to the regulatory safety and environmental legislation set by DOLE, BFP and DENR-EMB. Performs other duties and responsibilities that may be assigned from time to time. JOB QUALIFICATIONS: Candidate must possess at least Professional License in Engineering (Mechanical) or equivalent. At least 3 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Required Skill(s): With certification in BOSH, familiar with environmental and legal requirements Willing to be assigned in Marilao, Bulacan.

Job Description JOB SUMMARY The Pollution Control and Safety Officer is responsible for the routine inspection of the plant facilities to ensure that safety standards, regulations and procedures are strictly followed and implemented in order to achieve a zero accident in the workplace. MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Ensures proper maintenance of the plant facilities. 2. Assists all departments in understanding job hazards and safety precautions. 3. Ensures that all equipment and machinery are in good working condition and free from any accident hazards. 4. Make sure that all employees of the plant remain safe from potentially hazardous conditions. 5. Ensures that all safety devices of the plant are well maintained and are in good operating condition such as fire pumps, fire extinguishers and other fire fighting accessories. 6. Implements company wide Safety programs as required by DOLE and other regulating agencies. 7. Oversee the creation, review and refinement of NDCI safety policies and practices. 8. Investigate serious or minor accidents of injury, property damage to ascertain cause and need for corrective action. Develops and implement measures and strategies to prevent their recurrence in order to meet-long-range loss-reduction goals. 9. Acts as Pollution Control Officer to ensure compliance with DENR and other program regulating agencies with regards to environmental standards. 10. Provides consultations, guidance and technical assistance on matters related to workplace safety and security. 11. Suggests and recommends necessary constructive measures ensuring improvement and productivity. 12. Ensures good housekeeping rules inside the plant. 13. Coordinates interface relationship with concerned units, sections or departments regarding project and safety pollution matters. QUALIFICATION: EDUCATION Graduate in Electrical, Mechanical or Civil Engineering preferably with license EXPERIENCE Three (3) years work experience in a related field

College Graduate Can speak English and Tagalog With experience as Safety Officer With BOSH Training responsible for planning, implementing and overseeing company's employee safety at work ﻿ Their main duty is to ensure that the company is in complience and adheres to Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) guidelines.

Job Qualifications: Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree , Engineering (Environmental/Health/Safety) or equivalent. At least 5 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Preferably Supervisor / 5 Yrs & Up Experienced Employees specializing in Engineering - Environmental/Health/Safety or equivalent. Must be DOLE-accredited Safety Officer With at least 5 years experience as HSSE Officer in manufacturing environment, preferably in oil & gas, petrochemical industry DENR-accredited Pollution Control Officer Experienced/trained in safety standards, particularly in OHSAS 18001 or ISO 45001 Proficient in ISO 9001 and 14001 Preferably living in or near in Valenzuela City Full-Time position(s) available. Job Description: Occupational Safety and Health 1. Assist site in the Annual Health & Safety Programming and Occupational Health and Safety Promotions. 2. Ensure all safety equipment and/or machineries are being maintained through regular inspection/testing. Conduct Accident/Incident Investigation. 3. Conduct safety orientation for newly hired employees, suppliers/contractors and visitors. 4. Ensure execution of required safety trainings (either outsourced or internal trainings). 5. Ensure monthly safety assessment and weekly inspections are being executed. 6. Recommend facilities and process improvement based on safety assessment/inspections. 7. Monitor safety projects and ensure that it is implemented and completed on agreed time and specifications. 8. Ensure compliance to permitting and reporting requirements of regulating Government Agency (i.e. DOLE, BFP, DENR, LLDA, LGUs, etc.). 9. Acts as site advisory in the application of health and safety programs to eliminate the hazards from workplace and correct unsafe work practices. 10. Acts in an advisory capacity on all matters pertaining to health and safety for the guidance of the management and workers. 11. Conducts investigation of accident as a member of the EHS Committee and submit separate reports analysis of accident to the management. 12. Conducts health and safety training programs for the employee and Management. 13. Conducts health and safety inspection as a member of the committee. 14. Proper maintenance of accident records and coordinates action taken by supervisors to eliminate accident causes. 15. Provide assistance to government or other agencies in the conduct of health and safety inspection, accident investigation or any other related programs. 16. Adhere and implement Company Policies, Good Housekeeping, Quality, Environmental, Health and Safety Policy and/or Program of the company. 17. Serve as the Secretary to the health and safety committee. As such, he shall • Prepare minutes of meetings • Report status of recommendation made • Notify members of the meeting; and • Submit to the Safety committee a report of the activities of the committee 18. Coordinates all health and safety training program for the employees and employer. 19. Maintain or helps in the maintenance of an efficient accident record system and coordinates action taken by supervisors to eliminate accident causes. 20. To implement and promote occupational safety and health programs in the workplace. 21. To advise and assist the Line Managers in complying with the provision of the health and safety standards especially in the submission of the reporting requirements. 22. To perform at least a quarterly appraisal/assessment of the implementations of occupational safety and health programs in the workplace. 23. To prepare the annual/semi-annual/quarterly/monthly report of safety and health programs of the site. 24. To be present during the scheduled safety inspection by authorized government agents and as requested during health and safety committee meetings. 25. Maintain the traffic management system is in accordance with the Health and Safety Procedures of the site. 26. Manage the safety control of contractors including safety permitting requirements. 27. Manage the safety implementations of fire safety including no ignition program implementation of the site. 28. Ensure safety of man machine interfacing onsite had been carried on the plant and communicated to all employees. 29. Conduct regular hazard identification risk and assessment control on the plant. 30. Focal person for plant security concerns. 31. Manage the operation of site Emergency Response Team. 32. Prepares site annual drill plan (Fire, Earthquake, Mass protest, etc.) and facilities implementation of the planned drills. 33. Implements site PPE requirements for production, maintenance and engineering works. Evaluates and recommends PPE for replacement. 34. He shall be empowered to STOP unsafe activities/conditions to prevent accidents. He shall inform the department head for proper coordination and correction of unsafe acts and conditions. 35. Shall conduct daily safety walkabout to ensure compliance to safety, security and environment policies and procedures. 36. Shall be the designated Work Permit Reviewer for the plant operations, shall review the job hazard analysis for the work permit and provide inputs to ensure safe performance of the work. 37. Performed other duties as may be assigned by the immediate superior. Environment 38. Act as Pollution Control Officer 39. Maintain current working knowledge of Environmental regulations 40. Interact with government agencies contacts and lead onsite environmental inspection from DENR, LLDA and other local and national agencies. 41. Manage the storage, recycle, re-use and disposal of residual and hazardous waste. 42. Monitor environment protection and abatement control installed onsite, including air pollution control source operation. 43. Facilitate the environmental testing required by the local authority based on agreed timeframe. 44. Monitor the usage of water and electricity and implement reduction program of the site. 45. Participate in 5S initiative of the company. 46. Conducts environment training programs for the employee and management. 47. Conduct regular Aspect Impact Activities onsite. 48. Prepare and submit Environment Quarterly and Semi-Annual report to DENR and LLDA. 49. Renew regulatory Permit and licenses of the site. 50. Conducts investigation of environmental accident and submit separate reports analysis of accident to the management. 51. Conducts environmental inspection and reports analysis of the inspection. Integrated Management System (ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001) 1. Support the implementation of ISO 9001, ISO 14001 and ISO 45001 for Valenzuela site. 2. Maintain Environment, Health and Safety documentation related procedures to ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001) 3. Keep abreast of the latest applicable local and national laws on Environment, Health and Safety. 4. Maintain the list of EHS legal requirements including reporting, permits, certificates and clearances and must be updated and readily available anytime. 5. Formulate EHS Procedures requirements in compliance with applicable HES legal requirements for Valenzuela site. GWP, GMP, GTP, GLP, 5S 1. Facilitate implementation of GWP, GMP, GTP, GLP and 5S and ensure compliance with set standards 2. Perform and maintain periodic audit 3. Provide preventive and corrective actions to address issues on non-compliance.

The position is project-based and will be required to report directly to the Safety Manager . Required /Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: a) Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor’s/College Degree in Engineering (Environment/Health/Safety) or any HSE discipline. b) With at least five (5) years of experience in performing Environmental Health and Safety c) Knowledge of BOSH/COSH d) Knowledgeable on Microsoft Office Software (MS Word, Excel, etc.) e) Effective communication with coworkers across the departments f) Willing to do field works and travel to project sites in the Philippines (LUZVIMIN) g) High sense of urgency h) Construction Management, Communication, Safety Compliance, Health Compliance, Attention to details. Job Description: 1. Inspect workplaces and workplace equipment to ensure that they meet safety regulations and identifies hazards and risk 2. Monitors and assesses hazardous and unsafe situations and developing measures to assure personnel safety 3. Implement OSHAS and EMS based on existing policies and procedures 4. Responsible for the proper use and inventory management of personal protective equipment (PPE) 5. Assist in the preparation of safety reports documents and forms 6. Support on regulatory and internal audit processes For interested applicants, kindly submit your application/resume and please fill up this link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScdI7DzzuKcRqsYUnu8eKGySgjwDKBQROKoHq1S2yhg3ltkGw/viewform

Performed other duties as may be assigned by the immediate superior. Environment 38. Act as Pollution Control Officer 39. Maintain current working knowledge of Environmental regulations 40. Interact with government agencies contacts and lead onsite environmental inspection from DENR, LLDA and other local and national agencies. 41. Manage the storage, recycle, re-use and disposal of residual and hazardous waste. 42. Monitor environment protection and abatement control installed onsite, including air pollution control source operation. 43. Facilitate the environmental testing required by the local authority based on agreed timeframe. 44. Monitor the usage of water and electricity and implement reduction program of the site. 45. Participate in 5S initiative of the company. 46. Conducts environment training programs for the employee and management. 47. Conduct regular Aspect Impact Activities onsite. 48. Prepare and submit Environment Quarterly and Semi-Annual report to DENR and LLDA. 49. Renew regulatory Permit and licenses of the site. 50. Conducts investigation of environmental accident and submit separate reports analysis of accident to the management. 51. Conducts environmental inspection and reports analysis of the inspection. Integrated Management System (ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001) 1. Support the implementation of ISO 9001, ISO 14001 and ISO 45001 for Valenzuela site. 2. Maintain Environment, Health and Safety documentation related procedures to ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001) 3. Keep abreast of the latest applicable local and national laws on Environment, Health and Safety. 4. Maintain the list of EHS legal requirements including reporting, permits, certificates and clearances and must be updated and readily available anytime. 5. Formulate EHS Procedures requirements in compliance with applicable HES legal requirements for Valenzuela site. GWP, GMP, GTP, GLP, 5S 1. Facilitate implementation of GWP, GMP, GTP, GLP and 5S and ensure compliance with set standards 2. Perform and maintain periodic audit 3. Provide preventive and corrective actions to address issues on non-compliance.

Job Responsibilities: Help organizations achieve best practice in terms of reporting on their non-financial performance by providing assurance services on reported data such as sustainability reports, greenhouse gas emissions inventories and the disclosure of climate-related financial risks. Handle the planning and executing of sustainability and Environmental, Social, Governance (ESG) services to current clients. Assist the partner in prospecting for new clients. Qualifications: Graduate of Bachelor’s degree in Environment Science, Environmental Engineering, Sustainability Management or related. Having a post graduate degree in a sustainability related field is an advantage. Has at least 6-8 years of experience in delivering sustainability/ ESG program services such as carbon/ greenhouse gas emission review and assessment, climate risk assessment, sustainability reporting, or energy management. Knowledgeable on most of the major ESG disclosure platforms reporting frameworks including but not limited to GRESB, CDP, GRI, <IR>, SASB, DJSI, TCFD. Has the ability to monitor time sensitive and complex client communications Excellent verbal and written communication skills, presentation and interpersonal skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office applications such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

JOB SUMMARY The Pollution and Control Safety Officer will establish company objectives, targets and programs that will help the company in the safety and environment program implementation. The position will be responsible for the preservation and protection of our natural resources, reduce the generation of company waste and establish mitigating measures on the control of pollution and protection of the environment. The role will also lead and coordinate the Manufacturing Plant's safety and health program. He will Implement the safety rules, regulations and processes and perform counter measures against accidents; coordinates with operations and management on safety concerns. FIELDS OF RESPONSIBILITY Prepare Environmental work plan and program Communicates Environmental program and guidelines Monitors implementation of environmental regulations and requirements Conducts safety and environmental audits Monitors compliance with the requirements of PD 1586, RA 6969, R 8749, RA 9003, RA 9275 and its IRR including Board Resolution 1996-33 for establishments under LLDA region. Authority to stop activities and recommend sanction to violators on established Environmental rules nd regulations Coordinates proper and legal disposal of hazardous waste QUALIFICATION BS Degree in Chemical Engineering/BS Mechanical Engineering preferably licensed At least 4 years of solid experience in safety and environmental requirements Experience in manufacturing plant with Pollution Control Facility Operations REQUIRED TRAINING 40-hour basic Pollution Control Officers Seminar (DENR-EMB) 40-hour Continuing Environmental Education Program for PCO Environmental Education Seminar (LLDA) 40-hour Continuing Environmental Education Seminar (LLDA) 40-hour Cumulative Advanced PCO Training (DENR-EMB) Basic Supervisory Training Course Basic Computer Training 7. ISO 9001, ISO 14001, OHSAS 18001 Awareness/QHSE Policy Other requirements as prescribed by DENR-EMB & LLDA

Job Title: Pollution Control Officer - Mt. Apo, Kidapawan
Job Description: JOB DESCRIPTION: Attends to the requirements of the company prior to the construction or installation of pollution control facilities including the application and securing of necessary pollution permits and renewal. Monitor activities pertaining the installation or construction of pollution source and control facilities with the end in view of ensuring compliance with air, noise and water quality standards; Supervise the proper operation and maintenance and pollution control facilities of the establishment or agency. Reports within reasonable time to the authority the breakdown of any pollution control facility, and the estimated and actual date of completion/repair and operation. Keep himself abreast with the requirements of the authority and the latest available technology on prevention, control and abatement of pollution Maintain liaison with the city/provincial/municipal or local pollution control officers Attend the meetings for Pollution Control Officers which may from time to time be called the authority Facilitate compliance of the company he represents with the requirements that may from time to time prescribed by the authority Recommend to the management the installation and operation of additional equipment for pollution abatement facilities. JOB QUALIFICATIONS: Candidate must possess a Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering or any equivalent course. With Basic PCO Training Course by an EMB-recognized training organization within the last three (3) years. Atleast with Basic Safety Officer Training and First Aid and Basic Life Support Training. Accredited with COA Number and 40 hours training With experience in securing DP, PTO and ECC is advantage With experience in renewal of PTO and DP or CNC Can do and submit the Self – Monitoring Report and Compliance Monitoring Report (SMR/CMR) Know the basic PD 1586, RA 8749, RA 6969, RA 9003, RA 9725 Must be proficient in Microsoft Office applications, particularly in Excel and Powerpoint. Must exhibit good communication and presentation skills. Must be organized and possesses a good sense of time management and attention to detail. With at least one (1) year related work experience preferably in an automotive industry.

JOB DESCRIPTION: Attends to the requirements of the company prior to the construction or installation of pollution control facilities including the application and securing of necessary pollution permits and renewal. Monitor activities pertaining the installation or construction of pollution source and control facilities with the end in view of ensuring compliance with air, noise and water quality standards; Supervise the proper operation and maintenance and pollution control facilities of the establishment or agency. Reports within reasonable time to the authority the breakdown of any pollution control facility, and the estimated and actual date of completion/repair and operation. Keep himself abreast with the requirements of the authority and the latest available technology on prevention, control and abatement of pollution Maintain liaison with the city/provincial/municipal or local pollution control officers Attend the meetings for Pollution Control Officers which may from time to time be called the authority Facilitate compliance of the company he represents with the requirements that may from time to time prescribed by the authority Recommend to the management the installation and operation of additional equipment for pollution abatement facilities. JOB QUALIFICATIONS: Candidate must possess a Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering or any equivalent course. With Basic PCO Training Course by an EMB-recognized training organization within the last three (3) years. Atleast with Basic Safety Officer Training and First Aid and Basic Life Support Training. Accredited with COA Number and 40 hours training With experience in securing DP, PTO and ECC is advantage With experience in renewal of PTO and DP or CNC Can do and submit the Self – Monitoring Report and Compliance Monitoring Report (SMR/CMR) Know the basic PD 1586, RA 8749, RA 6969, RA 9003, RA 9725 Must be proficient in Microsoft Office applications, particularly in Excel and Powerpoint. Must exhibit good communication and presentation skills. Must be organized and possesses a good sense of time management and attention to detail. With at least one (1) year related work experience preferably in an automotive industry.

Key Performance Areas Participates in the development, improvement and maintenance of safety programs such as fire protection, emergency preparedness plans, entry/egress of vehicles/visitors and other occupational safety and health procedures. Analyzes accidents and incident reports for trends and makes recommendations for correcting unsafe conditions and actions. Leads and coordinates the safety inspection process. Participates in creating employee training programs in environmental/sanitation standards. Liaises with internal contacts and government agencies for application and renewal of health and safety permits. Qualifications Graduate of B.S Industrial Engineering or any related course. 3 years of experience in occupational safety and industrial hygiene practices in a food manufacturing set-up Knowledge of occupational safety and industrial hygiene laws/regulations Skill in performing safety inspections ensuring compliance with government laws/regulations on safety, health and sanitation. Ability to investigate and analyze information and come up with conclusion Skill in developing safety procedures and protocols Ability to react calmly and effectively in emergency situations Ability to communicate new information to target audience. Skill in operating workplace software applications such as MS Office, Visio and/or Autocadd.

Environmental and Permitting Specialist Job Description: General Position Definition: · Processes permits for Oil and Gas projects (i.e., T&S Engineering Maintenance and New Projects, etc. · Take a lead in ECC permit application and prepare needed reports (i.e., ESHIA, EIS, etc.). · Communicates business intentions to relevant government agencies concerned and brings government agencies’ views back into the business/clients. · Implements and maintains the regular reporting mechanism for proactive management of potential permitting issues. Accountabilities: · Permitting leg work application for various projects · Provision of Permitting reports required (i.e., ESHIA report, etc.) · Provision of inputs on permitting database for CHARTE Consultancy projects. · Take a leading role in: o Providing environmental and project permitting expertise CHARTE projects o Ensure project compliance with environmental regulations and applicable standards. o Provide dedicated Permits/Consents and Compliance Management for CHARTE Permitting projects. o Organize regular meetings for permit coordination with relevant stakeholders o Increase permits and compliance visibility by providing comprehensive reporting, automated e-mail reminders and dashboards. o Accountable for the filing of permitting documentation: ensure that originals or copies of the relevant permits are stored and can be retrieved in accordance with the applicable records management standards. · Facilitate meetings with various stakeholders involved with project permitting (monitoring, waste disposal, remediation, grievance mechanisms, social investment programs, etc.), including coordinating with the Community Liaison Officer where these involve communities. · Prepare impact assessment reports, including development of environmental and social performance management plans for CHARTE permitting projects · Regular coordination with clients · Daily interfacing with managers, clients, vendors, suppliers, logistics team members and procurement team members; · Process permits for T&S terminals across the Philippines involving Engineering Maintenance and new projects · Work with Projects Team in the development of a permits and compliance plan · Facilitate consultation between Shell staff, contractors and host community members · Prepare regular monthly status reports and quarterly reports · Act as an interface with programs related to project studies, such as Impact Assessments · Understand the opportunities, challenges, trends, issues and risks in the external landscape through stakeholder sensing and engagement related to permitting Dimensions: Role will focus on permitting projects for clients (i.e., mostly Oil & Gas industry players). Also, there are a number of existing projects and sites, as well as a number of new business development opportunities in Philippines, which involves dealing with fence line communities and other local stakeholders. This role will need to work closely with the clients (i.e., with site ER managers or project BOMs, terminal managers, etc.) to bring the insights and expectations from external stakeholders to the decision-making process, making sure that external expectations are managed and taken into account in making business decisions for permitting. Special Challenges: · Understand permitting concerns, expectations and needs · Effective relationship management with government agencies, LGUs especially DENR for permitting · Persuasive in discussions with internal (senior) stakeholders Experience and Qualifications Required: · Registered Preparer of Environmental Impact Assessment Reports at the DENR · Relevant experience in managing permitting projects especially ECC applications · Capacity to carry out basic permit applications for projects. · Relevant experience in permitting process for Oil and Gas facilities · Good understanding of Oil and Gas permitting process · Good interpersonal and influencing skills · Ability to understand multi-cultural settings and adaptable to various social environments

Job Duties: Manage overall operations by planning, controlling and monitoring operations activities to ensure that deliverables and metrics are met and one on time. Report their operation findings to upper management as needed. Send monthly performance report on fuel facilities operations, audit findings, and manpower performance. Estimate risks and apply risk minimizing techniques Conduct once a week spot audit on all sites to ensure that the operation is compliant with HSSE standards. Maintain safe and healthy work environment by establishing, following and enforcing standards and procedure; complying with legal regulations. Present with a report and recommendation on every spot audit. Perform other functions or participates in ad-hoc projects as may be assigned from time to time. Job Qualifications: Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering or any equivalent. At least three (3) years’ related work experiences gained from similar or related industry Preferably with Basic Occupational Safety & Health (BOSH) training. With experience in handling people as a Supervisor for at least three (3) years Preferably with Driver's license

MAIN RESPONSIBILITY: Responsible in planning, organizing, developing, implementing, controlling and promoting activities and programs of Environmental, Occupational Health and Safety to ensure the safety of life and property within the organization. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Assist in compliance, review, general risk assessment and other safety assessments to support health, safety and Environment Management. Maintain relevant HSE log and documentation & Prepare applicable HSE report as necessary Assist in the compliance of applicable laws and regulation Provide assistance and advice on HSE issues to make recommendation to facility management Participate in detailed incident investigation and root cause analysis & Promote incident prevention for the benefit of employees and visitors Assist in the development and presentation of relevant HSE training & Comply with company and HSE procedures and policies Observe HSE regulations, wear all required safety equipment, encourages safe working practices, correct obvious hazard immediately or reports them to the proper personnel Ability to work with employees and achieve cultural change in the face of potential resistance Maintain positive and proactive relation with manager and employees as well as customers and regulatory agencies Perform other work related tasks as required. Walk the manufacturing floor on a regular basis to establish HSE presence and provide support Conduct daily and monthly HSE meeting / training and schedule needed & Perform facility HSE inspection Write implement and manage HSE Programs, Policies and procedures Ability to evaluate PPE and ensure proper use and maintenance of PPE Have knowledge and enforce compliance of Regulatory requirements including company HSE policies and procedures Ability to Oversea Hazardous Waste storage and endure regulatory agency compliance Assist emergency response and provide First Aid treatment Follow fall Protection program inspect all fall protection Plan and Oversee Vehicle Maintenance and Safety Qualifications: Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering (Environmental/Health/Safety) or equivalent. At least 3 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Required Skill(s): SO2 or SO3 Certified Preferably Supervisor/5 Yrs & Up Experienced Employee specialized in Engineering - Environmental/Health/Safety or equivalent. Must be willing to assign in General Trias Cavite

· Reporting directly to RHDHV Project Leaders and undertaking Civil or Marine Inspections functions. · Support the Engineer’s Representative and Construction team with planning, coordinating and implementing of effective HSE policies, guidelines and procedures to ensure that the department objectives are met. · Provide support and coordinates with Construction Management Team in all aspects of safety, occupational health and environmental issues. · Support the Team in ensuring HSE compliance onshore and offshore and perform regular HSE audits in the areas of business and vessel operations. · Monitoring of concepts, rules and regulations related to health and safety measures, health and environmental protection. · Assist Project Control Manager on assessment for the approval of Contractor’s HSE plans and programs. · Arrange OSHA-mandated evaluations of the site. · Establish and maintain health and safety communication structure for the entire project site. · Attend/initiate and support ER and Project Control Manager during HSE meetings. · Liaison with the Multiparty Monitoring Team (MMT) assessing compliance with the EIS/ECC · Submits manpower and safety statistics and related reports to Project Control (daily, weekly, monthly).

Job Title: Supervisor (Retail and Corporate - Health, Environment, and Safety - Visayas)
Job Description: Every role in SEAOIL contributes significantly to the company. Here’s a summary of what you will be doing in this job: 1. Ensures and maintains safety facilities located in the assigned area 2. Ensures compliance with environmental policies pertinent to company needs Success in this role will require you to fulfill the following responsibilities: 1. Ensures that all HES policies, procedures, rules and regulations are communicated and complied with in the assigned region. 2. Ensures that all accidents are documented, investigated, and recommendations are implemented. 3. Ensures that safety inspections are carried out, fire drills are correctly reported; and safety inspections, risk assessments, and working procedures are managed in the assigned region. 4. Documents and maintains health and safety inspections, audits, and checks in the assigned region. 5. Prepares, manages, and safekeeps all DOLE required reports. 6. Monitors and keeps abreast of relevant OSH issues and best practices and communicates/escalates updates to stakeholders and relevant organizations/committees. 7. Liaises with suppliers for procurement of health and safety resources in the assigned region. 8. Ensures delivery and execution of safety training, as needed. 9. Implements, executes and monitors plans and programs in accordance with environmental laws and regulations in each locality within the assigned region. 10.Performs other functions that may be assigned from time to time. Preferred Qualifications for this Role: Graduate of any Engineering course Preferably licensed engineer With mandatory forty (40) - hour basic OSH (BOSH/COSH) training course applicable to the industry With additional forty - eight (48) hours of advanced/ specialized occupational safety training course relevant to the industry and with other requirements as prescribed by OSH standards Trained in PCO is an advantage Qualified SO3 level With at least two (2) years of experience in OSH With experience in safety and background knowledge in using Multi-gas detector With knowledge in confined space environment and knowledge in permit to work system Expectations from Candidates: Candidates who are invited for HR screening will need to undergo and pass an online exam and/or technical exam, and accomplish HR documents, personality tests, and essay exams before proceeding to the HR interview. Candidates who pass the HR interview would then need to submit soft copies of their available pre-employment requirements, such as the Transcript of Records, Diploma, and NBI clearance. The complete list will be provided by the recruiter. In the event candidates are hired, they would be required to submit hard copies of all the pre-employment requirements and pass the medical exam and background check before onboarding. Benefits of Working in the Company: 1. Office-based positions can enjoy the privilege of working from home during the pandemic 2. Employees will have the opportunity to be trained by our in-house training team and subject matter experts 3. Early regularization opportunity 4. Family-oriented culture

Responsibilities and Duties Develops and ensures implementation of occupational and environmental safety and health policies, procedures, rules and regulations. Develops and implements communication & training strategies to ensure all knows and understands the set OSH policies/guidelines. Coordinates and collaborates with the Compliance Department and HR Department in relation to the development and implementation of OSH and other compliance requirements set by the different regulatory Ensures company compliance on OSH related requirements as based on released requirements by different regulatory agencies in all countries of operations bodies. Works with the Compliance Department and HR Department in the conduct of audits on OSH and compliance across the different areas of operations. Carries out inspections of workplace/facilities and takes appropriate action to ensure compliance. Inspects work premise and the work of personnel to identify issues or non-conformity (e.g. not using protective equipment) to ensure a hazard-free environment in the workplace. Ensures that all OSH-related incidents (e.g, accidents, no-compliance, etc.) are documented, investigated and addressed following the set compliance guidelines. Verifies that all safety tools and equipment provided in the different company facilities are working, adequate and safe for use. Conducts OSH related trainings and carries out drills and exercises on how to manage emergency & crisis situations for both local and international offices. Works with the Crisis Management Team and Leader in the implementation of defined crisis and emergency response plan. Prepares various safety related reports, documents and forms. Performs other related duties, as assigned. Qualifications Candidate must possess at least a Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam) in Nursing or equivalent. Minimum of three years' experience in the Occupational Safety and Health field. Must be a DOLE accredited OSH Practitioner (Occupational Health and Safety). With Proven experience in planning, development and implementation of occupational health, wellbeing, safety and environmental strategies in the workplace Highly organized and keen to details Should be calm, patient and assertive, with excellent negotiation, communication and interpersonal skills. He or she should have strong analytical, problem-solving and organizational skills. Good presentation skills Willing to work in Silang, Cavite.

Location: Makati City, Mandaluyong City, Manila City, Pasig City, Quezon City
Job Description: The Safety and Security Manager is responsible for the organization-wide development, planning, and execution of health and safety plans. Will also be the main POC for all security-related matters and management of Covid-19 Emergency Response. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Operationalizes relevant Occupational Health and Safety legislation and translates it to internal procedures and processes Conducts risk assessments relevant to OHS and provides necessary action plans to enforce preventive measures Initiates and conducts OHS training of all PH employees and leaders Reviews, signs and submits pertinent information or OHS reports required by government agencies and LGUs Keeps abreast of evolving OHS guidelines and protocols set by government agencies (e.g. IATF) Creates and maintains the policies, standards, procedures, and documentation for site security. Ensures that the policies and standards for security are fit for purpose, updated, and are correctly implemented in the entire organization Liaises with contracted security officers/security guards for all security-related concerns Keeps track of all security-related concens in the organization by maintaining records and documentation Ensures efficient and effective delivery of services and exceeds SLA's desired result (minimal to no error) Exerts all efforts and possibilities to provide solutions and services the internal and external clients expect and require Provides necessary coaching, mentoring and assistance to team members regularly and discusses stats and action plans in order for the team to achieve their targets Empowers the team members by applying appropriate motivational approaches to match individual needs Initiates the overall review, analysis and improvement of the unit's performance in terms of productivity and quality to identify operational strengths, profit opportunities and areas for growth and development JOB SPECIFICATIONS: Must have at least a Bachelor's Degree in any field, but preferably related Occupational Health and Safety and Security At least 3 years of relevant work experience at supervisory or managerial capacity Must have at least 3 years of Occupational Health and Safety experience Must be a Safety Training Officer -- 4 trained and certified by DOLE/OSHC Must have demonstrated experience in creating and enforcing OHS policies Must have demonstrated experience facilitating learning sessions Must have familiarity with internet usage, MS Office products, and other various operating systems Must have solid project management, problem-solving and innovative skills Must have excellent English oral and written communication skills

Graduate of any 4 year course Must be an OSH Practitioner with DOLE Certificate At least 3 years working experience in the same capacity exposed in Vertical Construction Implements the Safety policies and procedures at the project site • Conducts safety evaluation and inspection at the project site Ensures that employees and workers are free from any danger, unsafe practices, risks or injury in the workplace or project site Maintains close communication and coordination with the Management with matters related to safety, health and environment issues Prepares and submits necessary reports and documents required by the Management Effective verbal/written and listening communications skills Analytical with good decision making skills, keen on details very effective planning & organizational skills

Job Qualifications: Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in any field. At least 3 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. With certificates in BOSH and COSH Required Skill(s): project management, health and safety compliance Willing to do field work to ensure OSH Compliance in site projects DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: As a Safety Officer, the main goal is to foster a safe working environment according to legal standards. Must be responsible to the overall safety of construction workers, Engineers and all other employees. Determining hazards and recommending solutions for the safety of all. Conducts inspections daily for employees and project site. The Safety Officer must ensure the proper implementation of our Company Rules and regulations and policies as compliance with DOLE standards. Must be knowledgeable in Construction Occupational Safety and Health (COSH) Being updated on Health and Safety updates and protocols related to pandemic prevention and control is a PLUS. Performs other related tasks that may be assigned from time to time. PROJECT BASED WILLING to be assigned on different project sites

Support the development of OHS policies and programs Registered as a Safety and Health Officer with Department of Occupational Safety and Health (“DOSH”) Advise and instruct on various safety-related topics (noise levels, use of machinery etc.) Conduct risk assessment and enforce preventative measures Review existing policies and measures and update according to legislation Initiate and organize OHS training of employees and executives Inspect premises and the work of personnel to identify issues or non-conformity (e.g. not using protective equipment) Oversee installations, maintenance, disposal of substances etc. Stop any unsafe acts or processes that seem dangerous or unhealthy Record and investigate incidents to determine causes and handle worker’s compensation claims Prepare reports on occurrences and provide statistical information to upper management. Proven experience as safety officer In depth knowledge of legislation (e.g. OSHA/EPA) and procedures Knowledge of potentially hazardous materials or practices Experience in writing reports and policies for health and safety Familiarity with conducting data analysis and reporting statistics Outstanding organizational skills Diligent with great attention to detail Excellent communication skills with the ability to present and explain health and safety topics Certificate in occupational health and safety.

Completed training in COSH and BOSH prescribed by DOLE for Site Safety Officer; Licensed Nurse preferred but not required; Certified First Aider is an advantage; At least 5 years experience as Safety Officer in Vertical/Horizontal Construction; Computer literate; Willing to be assigned in the province > Salary commensurate to qualifications Send Resume with ID picture to: Asset Builders Corporation Unit 2106A East Tower, PSE Centre Exchange Road, Ortigas Center, Pasig City Mobile No. 0917-6559344

This is for our client involved in the Engineering/Construction Industry. The candidate will be deployed in Eastern Samar. Job Responsibilities Continuous inspection of project sites, to ensure a hazard-free environment Identify, document, and correct unsafe site conditions in coordination with site operations management. Supervise and administer safety activities. Conduct employee safety orientation training program. Conduct work area surveillance, audits, inspections, property damage, and personal injury investigations. Accompany all safety, management, and insurance inspectors on walk-through tours. Creating and enforcing safety guidelines and programs Carrying out drills and exercises on managing emergency situations Conducting investigations on accidents Verifying that all safety reports are submitted to related government institutions. Perform other duties as assigned Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or related course Valid competency certificates Registration as a Safety Officer 3 (SO3) Strong communication skills Minimum of 3 years of experience in this position. Proficient in all Microsoft Applications.

GCSS Inc. is looking for an Associate Consultant - Sustainability to assist its clients in preparing their sustainability reports. The Associate Consultant will support the Lead Consultant and delivering the projects for the clients in the area of sustainability and will be accountable to handle the project. This is a client-facing role and the person should have excellent behavioral and communication skills and is willing to travel. MAIN DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES - Deliver consulting projects for clients; - Fulfill responsibilities allocated by the project manager in the project; - Coordinate with the project team on day to day operational activities for the projects; - Analyze, review and report on the data/information collected as required in the project; - Stay up to date with market needs and respond by developing new services and team skills; - Grow Company’s reputation and develop proposals / respond to tenders; - Support in preparing white papers, research articles, case studies as required; - Support the sales team when needed; - Develop training topics/materials related to sustainability as and when required. SKILLS & EXPERIENCE - Basic / Clear understanding & experience in GRI Standards and Sustainability Reporting. - Enthusiastic in learning more and developing skills in the area of sustainability. - Experience in building and maintaining relationships with clients is added advantage. - Outstanding verbal and communication skills. - Team Player and Self-Motivated. - Bachelors Degree – Environment Science or related area. - Certifications in Sustainability and Reporting will be added advantage. - Fresh Graduates willing to grow in the area of Sustainability are welcome to apply. PERFORMANCE KPIs - Customer Satisfaction - Timeliness & Accuracy - Project Management - Productivity & Efficiency - Eagerness to Learn - Professionalism

JOB DESCRIPTION: Attends to the requirements of the company prior to the construction or installation of pollution control facilities including the application and securing of necessary pollution permits and renewal.Monitor activities pertaining the installation or construction of pollution source and control facilities with the end in view of ensuring compliance with air, noise and water quality standards; Supervise the proper operation and maintenance and pollution control facilities of the establishment or agency.Reports within reasonable time to the authority the breakdown of any pollution control facility, and the estimated and actual date of completion/repair and operation.Keep himself abreast with the requirements of the authority and the latest available technology on prevention, control and abatement of pollutionMaintain liaison with the city/provincial/municipal or local pollution control officersAttend the meetings for Pollution Control Officers which may from time to time be called the authorityFacilitate compliance of the company he represents with the requirements that may from time to time prescribed by the authorityRecommend to the management the installation and operation of additional equipment for pollution abatement facilities. JOB DESCRIPTION: Attends to the requirements of the company prior to the construction or installation of pollution control facilities including the application and securing of necessary pollution permits and renewal. Monitor activities pertaining the installation or construction of pollution source and control facilities with the end in view of ensuring compliance with air, noise and water quality standards; Supervise the proper operation and maintenance and pollution control facilities of the establishment or agency. Reports within reasonable time to the authority the breakdown of any pollution control facility, and the estimated and actual date of completion/repair and operation. Keep himself abreast with the requirements of the authority and the latest available technology on prevention, control and abatement of pollution Maintain liaison with the city/provincial/municipal or local pollution control officers Attend the meetings for Pollution Control Officers which may from time to time be called the authority Facilitate compliance of the company he represents with the requirements that may from time to time prescribed by the authority Recommend to the management the installation and operation of additional equipment for pollution abatement facilities. JOB QUALIFICATIONS: Candidate must possess a Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering or any equivalent course. With Basic PCO Training Course by an EMB-recognized training organization within the last three (3) years. Atleast with Basic Safety Officer Training and First Aid and Basic Life Support Training. Must be proficient in Microsoft Office applications, particularly in Excel and Powerpoint. Must exhibit good communication and presentation skills. Must be organized and possesses a good sense of time management and attention to detail. With at least one (1) year related work experience preferably in an automotive industry.

Candidate must possess at least Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam) in Engineering (Environmental/Health/Safety) or equivalent. At least 3 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Preferably 1-4 Yrs Experienced Employee specialized in Engineering - Environmental/Health/Safety or equivalent.

Preferably 1-4 Yrs Experienced Employee specialized in Engineering - Environmental/Health/Safety or equivalent. With forty (40)-hour basic OSH training (COSH) and additional forty-eight (48) hours of advanced/specialized occupational safety training course Willing to be assigned in remote area With First Aid Training JOB DESCRIPTION: Conduct work-site Risk Assessment, Operations Risk Assessment, and Risk Management. Incident / Accident investigation, recording, and reporting. Conduct in-house training on safety practices and safety orientation to newly hired employees and safety training on-site. Conduct or attend ESH Committee Meeting. Maintains record on noise level, temperature, and environmental, chemical, and biological hazards present in the workplaces and identifies controls to reduce or eliminate such. Recommend continual workplace improvement and control measures. Implements and enforces company rules and regulations including national, local, and community laws pertaining to Safety, Health, and Environmental issues that may change from time to time be prescribed. Conduct safety lectures/training to contractors (construction projects and subcontracted works) regarding hazards to which they are exposed and conducts familiarization of the work environment. Schedules and conducts monthly meetings for the Health and Safety Committee including preparation of agenda and other related matters; takes minutes and disseminates results of meetings to the top management. Implements and enforces company rules and regulations including national, local, and community laws pertaining to Safety, Health, and Environmental issues that may change from time to time be prescribed. Proactively collect and file documents from proposals, project reports, manuals, delivery receipts, and other documents necessary for safekeeping. Safe keep and facilitate distribution of PPE Request PPEs needed for employees and ensures that all workers wear complete PPE and follow the company's policies on safety Perform all other related functions that may be assigned from time to time
