Job Description: Purpose of the Position: Reporting to the Corporate Health Safety and Environment Manager or AVP-QSHE on his/her behalf, the Pollution Control Officer is accountable and responsible for the preparation and implementation of Environmental programs for the project. Duties and Responsibilities: Keep abreast of Environmental Management Bureau’s requirements as well as the Client’s on pollution control. Safety responsibilities in performing the job in his/her area of influence. Attend to the necessary permit requirement of the government (EMB) before operating a facility. Ensure compliance of Pollution Control Facilities to government standards. On-time submission of Quarterly Self-Monitoring Report to EMB. Act as liaison officer to EMB, client, and other pollution regulating body including the local government pollution control office. Attend the meeting of pollution control officers which from time to time be called by EMB. Monitor the generation and disposal of used oil, batteries, and other hazardous waste. Keep records/documents of hazardous waste disposal, manifest form, and other related supporting documents. Handle other environmental concerns as required by the client and other government agencies. Perform other duties and responsibilities that may be required from time to time. Qualifications, Skills, and Experience: Graduate of any Engineering course, preferably Mining and/or Environmental Science Accredited PCO by EMB High level of interpersonal skills and integrity; Creative, forward thinker. Able to deliver effective results, meet tight deadlines and targets Ability to interact with staff (at all levels) in a fast-paced environment, sometimes under pressure, remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful, and efficient. Ability to multitask and work well under pressure. A reliable professional who follows the organization and department procedures, and completes tasks promptly.

JOB DESCRIPTION We are looking for a responsible Safety Officer to facilitate compliance with occupational health and safety (OHS) guidelines. You will provide advice on measures to minimize hazards or unhealthy situations. You will also be on a constant lookout for violations. The ideal candidate will be a responsible individual who swears by OSH regulations. Your work will be largely focused on prevention so you need to be conscientious and farsighted. The ideal candidate will also be detail-oriented and ready to act in emergencies. The goal is to establish a safe workplace according to legal standards and foster a culture of attention to health and safety. Responsibilities Conduct risk assessment and enforce preventative measures Inspect premises and the work of personnel to identify issues or non-conformity (e.g. not using protective equipment) Stop any unsafe acts or processes that seem dangerous or unhealthy Prepare reports on occurrences and provide statistical information to upper management Lead/Assist relevant organizations in the investigation of any accident, and prepare recommendations to mitigate these incidents Conduct of studies and benchmarking activities to identify appropriate solutions to strengthen organizational safety performance Requirements Graduate of any 4 year course Completed mandatory forty (40)-hour basic OSH training Completed an additional 48 hour Advanced/Specialized Occupational Safety Training Course At least 2 years experience in Occupation Safety and Health function At least 1 year of supervisory experience In depth knowledge of legislation (e.g. OSHA/EPA) and procedures Knowledge of potentially hazardous materials or practices Experience in writing reports and policies for health and safety program design and implementation Proficient in MS Office; Working knowledge of safety management information systems is a plus Outstanding organizational skills Excellent communication skills with the ability to present and explain health and safety topics

Monitor the response operation, investigate any damage to the environment and economic resources and evaluate the consequences. Record and report findings concisely and promptly to the ITOPF anchor, P&I Club case handlers, shipowners, IOPC Funds, and others as appropriate, both with written and verbal, sometimes under extreme time pressure and at inhospitable hours of the day Qualifications : Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree , Engineering (Environmental/Health/Safety) or equivalent. At least 12 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Has proven experiences in participating in response operations to oil pollution incidents. Applicants must be willing to work in Khobar,Eastern Province. 10 Full-Time position(s) available. Job Description Designs and directs construction and operation of hygienic projects such as waterworks, sewage, garbage and trash disposal plants, drainage systems, and insect and rodent control projects: Plans development of watersheds and directs building of aqueducts, filtration plants, and storage and distribution systems for water supply. Plans and directs workers in building and operation of sewage-disposal plants. Advises industrial plants in disposal of gases, oils, greases, and other chemicals. Inspects and regulates sanitary condition of public places, such as markets, parks, and camps. May plan and direct operation of water treatment plant to soften and purify water for human consumption or industrial use and be known as Water-Treatment-Plant Engineer. Minimum Qualifications · Candidate must be a graduate of Environmental Engineering, or related discipline · Must have 1-2 years of experience in related field · Strong analytical and planning skills, organizational skills, attention to detail, time-management and follow through · Good written and oral communication skills · Excellent problem-solving skills · Willing to be based in Pampanga

The role shall be responsible for leading the development and implementation of ESH Management System (MS). This role shall manage the Contractor ESH management process of the projects undertaken by various business units and monitor compliance with local ESH regulatory requirements, specifically those mandated by Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE), Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR), Department of Energy (DOE) and Local Government Units (LGUs). Preferably knowledgeable and with a good background on industry ESH standards and local ESH regulations Preferably with background on ISO 14001, 45001 and 9001 Minimum of 5 years experience and demonstrated technical and operational working knowledge in the field of Environment, Occupational Safety and Health particularly in the power generation industry Possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (licensed) or other related courses

Job Title: Environmental. Health and Safety Officer (Cabuyao, Laguna)
Job Description: Duties and Responsibilities: To supervise the implementation and enforcement of EHS policies and procedures within the assigned plant facility. Assists in the development of new policies Conducts trainings across all function related to EHS Serves as the Facility's Pollution Control Officer and Safety Officer of Plant as required by the local regulatory agencies. Liases and coordinate with government agencies for on-time processing/ renewal of all required environmental permits of the plant Submits environmental monitoring reports imposed required by the regulatory office for the plant Conducts environmental training/ seminars and drill/exercises for plant associates on a regular basis Conducts investigation of an accident or incident occuring within the plant and prepare report based on the observations and recommends measures to prevent the recurrence. Implements the EHS program for the plant Implements, administers and advises Plant Function heads on hazards controls and corrective action programs Conducts monthly inspection of all fire protection system and other related safety and lifesaving equipment Measures, evaluates and audits the effectiveness of the hazard control program for the plant Assists the EHS Manager to carry out the environmental, health and safety efforts in the plant such as program development and implementation, employee training, record keeping and reporting, personnel exposure monitoring, inspections and audits, EMS and OSHA compliance. Participates in the safety and good housekeeping programs as established within the plant Heads the formation and organization of plant emergency services/ incidents management team Monitors Plant’s solid and hazardous waste management and ensure compliance with the Company and regulatory standards. Forms and Organizes the Plant’s spill control team and conduct relevant training on a periodic services Leads the Emergency/ Spill Response Team for the plant and be responsible for maintaining the team in accordance with the standards. Coordinates with the other departments in the implementation of EHS procedures within the plant Performs other environment, health and safety related duties as directed by EHS Manager.

Job Description Promote safety and security within the organization Conduct safety and security lectures and related training activities Inspect workplaces and workplace equipment to ensure they meet safety regulations Identify hazards and risks in the manufacturing plant Ensure that the workplace conform with organizational procedures and safety standards Ensure personal protective equipment (such as hearing protection, dust masks, safety glasses, footwear and safety helmets), are being used in workplaces according to regulations Ensure that the organization is aware of, and complies with, all legislation relating to its duty of care, workplace activities and the use of its plant, equipment and substances Record and report hazards, accidents and injuries within the workplace Investigate accidents and unsafe working conditions, study possible causes and recommend remedial action Conducts toolbox meeting Coordinate emergency procedures Report the status of of safety and security programs Assist in developing safety and security systems, including policies, procedures and manuals Qualifications Graduate of any 4-year degree course With at least 5 years of related work experience in the manufacturing industry With BOSH Certification Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Strong analytical, planning and problem-solving skills Proficient in MS Office applications High customer focus and results orientation

Job Qualifications: Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree , Engineering (Environmental/Health/Safety) or equivalent. At least 5 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Preferably Supervisor / 5 Yrs & Up Experienced Employees specializing in Engineering - Environmental/Health/Safety or equivalent. Must be DOLE-accredited Safety Officer With at least 5 years experience as HSSE Officer in manufacturing environment, preferably in oil & gas, petrochemical industry DENR-accredited Pollution Control Officer Experienced/trained in safety standards, particularly in OHSAS 18001 or ISO 45001 Proficient in ISO 9001 and 14001 Preferably living in or near in Valenzuela City Full-Time position(s) available. Job Description: Occupational Safety and Health 1. Assist site in the Annual Health & Safety Programming and Occupational Health and Safety Promotions. 2. Ensure all safety equipment and/or machineries are being maintained through regular inspection/testing. Conduct Accident/Incident Investigation. 3. Conduct safety orientation for newly hired employees, suppliers/contractors and visitors. 4. Ensure execution of required safety trainings (either outsourced or internal trainings). 5. Ensure monthly safety assessment and weekly inspections are being executed. 6. Recommend facilities and process improvement based on safety assessment/inspections. 7. Monitor safety projects and ensure that it is implemented and completed on agreed time and specifications. 8. Ensure compliance to permitting and reporting requirements of regulating Government Agency (i.e. DOLE, BFP, DENR, LLDA, LGUs, etc.). 9. Acts as site advisory in the application of health and safety programs to eliminate the hazards from workplace and correct unsafe work practices. 10. Acts in an advisory capacity on all matters pertaining to health and safety for the guidance of the management and workers. 11. Conducts investigation of accident as a member of the EHS Committee and submit separate reports analysis of accident to the management. 12. Conducts health and safety training programs for the employee and Management. 13. Conducts health and safety inspection as a member of the committee. 14. Proper maintenance of accident records and coordinates action taken by supervisors to eliminate accident causes. 15. Provide assistance to government or other agencies in the conduct of health and safety inspection, accident investigation or any other related programs. 16. Adhere and implement Company Policies, Good Housekeeping, Quality, Environmental, Health and Safety Policy and/or Program of the company. 17. Serve as the Secretary to the health and safety committee. As such, he shall • Prepare minutes of meetings • Report status of recommendation made • Notify members of the meeting; and • Submit to the Safety committee a report of the activities of the committee 18. Coordinates all health and safety training program for the employees and employer. 19. Maintain or helps in the maintenance of an efficient accident record system and coordinates action taken by supervisors to eliminate accident causes. 20. To implement and promote occupational safety and health programs in the workplace. 21. To advise and assist the Line Managers in complying with the provision of the health and safety standards especially in the submission of the reporting requirements. 22. To perform at least a quarterly appraisal/assessment of the implementations of occupational safety and health programs in the workplace. 23. To prepare the annual/semi-annual/quarterly/monthly report of safety and health programs of the site. 24. To be present during the scheduled safety inspection by authorized government agents and as requested during health and safety committee meetings. 25. Maintain the traffic management system is in accordance with the Health and Safety Procedures of the site. 26. Manage the safety control of contractors including safety permitting requirements. 27. Manage the safety implementations of fire safety including no ignition program implementation of the site. 28. Ensure safety of man machine interfacing onsite had been carried on the plant and communicated to all employees. 29. Conduct regular hazard identification risk and assessment control on the plant. 30. Focal person for plant security concerns. 31. Manage the operation of site Emergency Response Team. 32. Prepares site annual drill plan (Fire, Earthquake, Mass protest, etc.) and facilities implementation of the planned drills. 33. Implements site PPE requirements for production, maintenance and engineering works. Evaluates and recommends PPE for replacement. 34. He shall be empowered to STOP unsafe activities/conditions to prevent accidents. He shall inform the department head for proper coordination and correction of unsafe acts and conditions. 35. Shall conduct daily safety walkabout to ensure compliance to safety, security and environment policies and procedures. 36. Shall be the designated Work Permit Reviewer for the plant operations, shall review the job hazard analysis for the work permit and provide inputs to ensure safe performance of the work. 37. Performed other duties as may be assigned by the immediate superior. Environment 38. Act as Pollution Control Officer 39. Maintain current working knowledge of Environmental regulations 40. Interact with government agencies contacts and lead onsite environmental inspection from DENR, LLDA and other local and national agencies. 41. Manage the storage, recycle, re-use and disposal of residual and hazardous waste. 42. Monitor environment protection and abatement control installed onsite, including air pollution control source operation. 43. Facilitate the environmental testing required by the local authority based on agreed timeframe. 44. Monitor the usage of water and electricity and implement reduction program of the site. 45. Participate in 5S initiative of the company. 46. Conducts environment training programs for the employee and management. 47. Conduct regular Aspect Impact Activities onsite. 48. Prepare and submit Environment Quarterly and Semi-Annual report to DENR and LLDA. 49. Renew regulatory Permit and licenses of the site. 50. Conducts investigation of environmental accident and submit separate reports analysis of accident to the management. 51. Conducts environmental inspection and reports analysis of the inspection. Integrated Management System (ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001) 1. Support the implementation of ISO 9001, ISO 14001 and ISO 45001 for Valenzuela site. 2. Maintain the list of EHS legal requirements including reporting, permits, certificates and clearances and must be updated and readily available anytime. 5. Provide preventive and corrective actions to address issues on non-compliance.

Responsibilities: Implements and deploys Health, Safety and Environmental programs that contribute to accident prevention and pollution-free workplace Directs, regulates and controls functions related to health and safety and environmental compliance Monitors and renews company regulatory permits, licenses and related documents Investigates incidents/accidents related to health and safety, and environmental compliance, determining the root cause and implementing corrective actions to eliminate similar problems in the future. JOB SUMMARY (at least 2-3 sentences) The Safety Officer will be responsible for the development, roll-out and overall management of the company’s safety and health program. KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES (Use additional sheets if necessary.) The Safety Officer shall be responsible for the following: · Develop and roll-out of safety and health programs for the company · Overall management of the safety and health program · Monitoring and inspection of any health and safety aspect of the company operations · Assist government inspectors in the conduct of safety and health inspection at any time · Lead/Assist relevant organizations in the investigation of any accident, and prepare recommendations to mitigate these incidents · Conduct of studies and benchmarking activities to identify appropriate solutions to strengthen organizational safety performance QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED PREFFERED Education (Degree, licensure, & certification) · Graduate of any 4 year course · SO3 officer · Completed mandatory 40-hour Basic OSH Training · Completed an additional 48 hour Advanced/Specialized Occupational Safety Training Course Experience · At least 2 years experience in Occupation Safety and Health function · At least 1 year of supervisory experience Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities · Knowledge of the relevant DOLE regulations · Experience in policy creation · Experience in safety and health program design and implementation · Experience in incident management and handling · Able to conduct training and awareness programs

ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEER Responsibilities: · Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor’s/College Degree · Overall in-charge in developing environmental strategies, programs and activities towards mitigation of environmental impact on progressive rehabilitation of mined-out areas in compliance with regulatory standards. It ensures the implementation and monitoring of these programs and strategies. · Serving as a technical advisor on environmental policies and standards to ensure regulatory applicability. · Address problems and develop environmental solutions to prevent damage. · Document and maintain plans, requirement, protocols, permits and standard operating procedures. · With excellent communication skills (oral&written) · Willing to be assigned in Cavite Plant · Full time position available Qualifications: · Working experience as an Environmental Officer is a plus. · Familiarity with quality assurance, documentation, environmental rules, regulations and best practices. · Project and personnel management skills We are a company with strong manufacturing presence in Asia. An engaging and rewarding career starts here!

• Manage plant health and safety policies, procedures, and implementations based on established guidelines from the Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) and Occupational Health and Safety (OSH) standards and industry standards set by the company, with a focus mainly on fire protection equipment and fire alarm / detection / suppression system monitoring inspection and maintenance • Manage emergencies such as ammonia release, sulphur dioxide release, hydrogen sulphide release, arsine gas release and other emergencies such as fire and explosion, molten metal spill, acid spill and fuel/oil spill • Oversee the implementation of the appropriate permit to work system (Energy Isolation, Hot Work, Critical Lift, and Working at Heights, Excavation and Confined Space), job safety analysis (JSA), procedures, work instruction/ guidelines for activities in the area/s of responsibility • Provide technical training to Safety Officers such as but not limited to using Safety Instruments (Gas Testers, etc.), conducting gas testing, performing audit and inspection, conducting risk assessment, conducting incident investigation and training of the SafeWork documents • Be involved with the Safety Team Leader and Superintendent in the planning of goals, objectives programs and the resource requirements of the Safety Inspection Group necessary for the operational requirements

Job Title: Safety Officer (from Trucking or Logistics Company) - Puerto Princesa, Palawan
Job Description: Responsibilities: In-charge for monitoring and assessing hazardous and unsafe conditions Develops measures in assuring personnel safety Ensures that Health, Safety, Security, and Environment (HSSE) plan is prepared and implemented Reviews and monitors Incident Action Plan for HSSE implications Exercises his authority in case of emergency in order to prevent or stop unsafe acts Conducts safety Induction / Orientation for newly hired employees and visitors Keeps employees abreast with HSSE trainings to ensure their readiness and enhance their safety acumen Investigates accidents that occur in the responsibility areas. Ensures that sub-contractors abide with the agreed HSSE policies and procedures of the company Assists in providing the requirements for ISO 14001:2015 and ISO 45001:2018 surveillance audit/certification Supports in the implementation of DENR, and DOLE – OSH requirements Performs other related tasks Qualifications: Candidate must possess an Engineering degree or any related 4-year course Must have at least two (2) years similar work experience/s gained from trucking or logistics company Preferably with Basic Occupational Safety & Health (BOSH) training Being a DOLE –Certified Safety Officer is an advantage Amenable to be assigned at Puerto Princesa, Palawan (partner's terminal) and to report to head office (Makati) from time to time One (1) Full time position available Skills & Personal Attributes Good communication (written and oral) Strong leadership Pro-active and able to work with less or minimal supervision Good presentation skills Computer skills Driving skills (is a plus)

To develop, implement and promote occupational safety and health programs in the workplace. To advise and assist the employer in complying with the provisions of the Standards, especially in the submission of the reporting requirements To perform at least a quarterly appraisal/ assessment of the implementation of occupational safety and health programs in the workplace To prepare and annual report of safety and health programs of establishments To be present during the scheduled safety inspections by authorized government agents and as requested during regular health and safety committee meetings. To prepare mandatory reports for compliance to be submitted to government agencies. Must have completed the 40-hour basic occupational safety and health training course. Strong personality, physically fit, strong communication skills Bachelors Degree

Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering or related field Must have at least 10 years of total work experience, and 6 years’ experience in related field, preferably in railways, elevated structures or bridges, and accredited by DOLE on Construction Site Safety/Construction Occupational Safety and Health (COSH) Able to establish Site Safety Plan according to Employer’s standard, safety management in compliance with Occupational Health and Safety Regulations and other related Philippines national and local standards/requirements Knowledgeable in site emergency response and rescue procedures Able to develop and provide clear instructions on site emergency response and rescue Promotes safety awareness and accident prevention at the construction site and throughout all stages of construction Initiates appropriate safety preventive and corrective actions immediately and whenever necessary Computer literate, versatile and excellent in report preparation is a must

The Pollution Control Officer (PCO) is responsible for ensuring compliance to all documentary requirements and ensuring proper filing of statutory environmental documents required by DENR such as Self-Monitoring Reports (SMR), Compliance Monitoring Report (CMR), Compliance Monitoring and Verification Report (CMVR) and other similar reporting and periodic audit, and such documents are readily available. Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering or related course Preferably a licensed Engineer; Pollution Control Accredited Two (2) years of relevant experience preferably in environmental management; Completion of forty (40) hours of relevant training; Has completed the basic PCO Training Course by an EMB recognized training organization within the last 3 years; Good communication skills in Filipino and English General Functions of the Position: Ensure compliance with the requirements of PD 1586, RA 6869, RA 8749, RA 9003, RA 9275, their respective implementing rules and regulations (IRRs), and other rules and regulations for environmental management; Ensure the proper performance, operation, and maintenance of environmental management facilities or systems of the establishment; Perform coordination work between the office and stakeholders such as Project Management Team, Construction Team, and relevant offices of other government agencies

Job Description: QUALIFICATIONS Graduate of any 4 or 5-year course, preferably Engineering Must have at least completed 40-hour BOSH training Knowledgeable in OSH regulatory standards At least 3 years proven experience as Safety Officer or relevant experience in Occupational Safety and Health in the Manufacturing industry Keen to safety details with excellent communication and leadership skills RESPONSIBILITIES Plan and implement OSH policies and programs Oversee overall workplace safety Assess risk and possible safety hazards in all aspects of safety operations Conduct risk assessment Adhere to DOLE and workplace OSH policies

JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Pollution Control Officer: Handles the requirements of the establishment or enterprises prior to be construction or installation of pollution control facilities. Monitors activities relating to the pollution source and control facilities to ensure their compliance with the air, noise and water quality standards. Administers operations and preservation of pollution control facilities. Cooperates with the Local Government Units and attends meetings for Pollution Control Officers which may from time to time called by the DENR. Maintain liaison with the city/provincial/municipal or local pollution control officers. Safety Officer: Ensure company's compliance to the mandated safety requirements being required by the government such as the Bureau of Fire and Protection and other related government agencies. Ensure activation of the following team that will handle/response in case of emergencies: > Emergency Response Team that will handle all types of emergency situation such as personnel, environment and health related emergencies. > Directs the accident prevention efforts of the establishment in accordance with the safety programs and government regulations in order to prevent accidents from occurring the workplace. > Reviews reports of inspection, accident investigations and implementation of program. Regularly conduct health and safety audit to identify potential hazards within the plant premises and submit recommendations to Top Management for proper corrective and prevention action.

As a Safety Application consultant, you will be involved in the entire project life cycle from pre-sales to customer advisory, configuration and development through implementation to maintenance. Duties & Responsibilities: As a Drug Safety consultant you will be the responsible for understanding the customer business processes, being knowledgably around regulatory requirements and have the ability to translate the customer requirements into system configurations covering both functional and technical. It is expected that you can translate requirements into an implementation strategy by leading, drive and conclude workshops. As the frequency of releases of regulatory requirements are increasing, a part of your responsibility role will be to support life sciences customers in the rapid configuration and implementation requirement into Veeva Vault Safety. With your ability to work as a consultant you can understand the customer state of an existing implementation, perform gap analyses and propose validation strategies to enable the customers to be in compliance of current and future requirements. You must be able to be the subject matter expertise on Drug Safety and Pharmacovigilance for customers and project teams. You role will also be to bring other people on board on the Safety journey from NNIT’s global organization. As the work is expected to be linked to the existing landscape of Drug safety application it will be an important skill to have understanding of applications and data models supporting the Drug Safety eg. ARGUS and ARISg. Qualification & Experience: You must have 5+ years of life sciences industry experience, with the majority spent in the Drug Safety and Pharmacovigilance domain and experience in a consulting function. Based on our profile and experience you must have an indept knowledge of Drug Safety and Pharmacovigilance processes and regulations. To enable the continous best consultancy it is needed that you possess a natural interest in the new technologies and are familiar with market leading Safety solution vendors. It is important that you: have extensively worked on implementations, upgrades, configurations and migrations of Drug Safety Databases like ARGUS and ARISg are able to act with speed to understand business requirements, create corresponding solution designs been exposed to life sciences compliance and computer systems validation requirements. have a strong customer centric approach and can understand and effectively communicate customer requirements and needs take pride in delivering on time and on budget while keeping the customers best interest in mind. are an ambitious team player enjoying taking responsibility of your own assignments have excellent communication skills in English Your personality requires that you have a willingness to “roll up your sleeves” to design and a part of configuring and driving Vault Safety projects. The abilities that will be an nice to have are: Proven track record supporting high impact global system implementation programs as a consultant, business, or IT lead, and/or business sponsor Direct experience with ARISg and/or other drug safety applications Life science, computer science, or related degree SaaS/Cloud experience Experience in services delivery management and/or systems implementation

At least 3 Year(s) of working experience specialized in Manufacturing/Production Operations or equivalent Knowledge of potentially hazardous material or practices. Background in Environmental Safety is an advantage Willing to work in Fortune, Marikina (Manufacturing Plant) Duties and Responsibilities: The Safety Officer is responsible for planning, implementing, and overseeing the company's employee safety at work. Identify process bottlenecks and offer timely solutions. Check if all the employees are acting in adherence with the Safety, Health, and Environment rules and regulations. Prepare and present reports on accidents and violations and determine causes. Oversee workplace repair, installations, and any other work that could harm employees' safety.

Company: Laguna International Industrial Park Association, Inc.
Job Description: Pollution Control Officer (PCO) & Safety Officer Job responsibilities: As a Safety Officer · Responsible for monitoring and assessing hazardous and unsafe situations and developing measures to assure personnel safety; · In-charge in formulating or developing measures to ensure personnel safety; · Responsible in preparation and submission of reports mandated by Department of Labor; · Plus other tasks deem necessary in the performance of duty as Safety Officer. As a PCO · Formulate, layout, and enforce operational procedures to support and comply all mandated EHS policies. Prepare, organize, and safe keep all documents relevant to EHS regulations and procedures. · Responsible in preparation and submission of reports mandated by DENR/LLDA/EMB/NWRB; · Daily inspection of operations of Sewerage Treatment Plant (STP) and performance of submersible motors installed at the AERATOR and CLARIFIER, inspection/observation of effluent and influent. · Occasional inspection of the Locators Sewer and Drainage lines for assurance that their residual waste water conforms with LLDA/EMB standards; · Plus other tasks deem necessary in the performance of duty as PCO. Qualifications: · Graduate of Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering · With Basic Occupational Safety and Health (BOSH) training · At least 2 years of experience as a PCO and Safety Officer or any related field is required · Competent in MS Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint) · Dedicated, hardworking, flexible and a team player · With good interpersonal and communication skills Be a part of our team and together let’s make the best happen!

Job Description: Tasked to implement occupational safety and health programs in the workplace in accordance with the provisions of the standards Act as the employer’s principal assistant and consultant in the application of program to remove the hazards from the workplace and to correct unsafe work practices Serves as Secretary to the Health and Safety Committee. As such, he/she shall: a. prepare minutes of meetings b. report status of recommendations made; c. notify members of the meetings and d. Submit to the employer a report of the facilities of the committee, including recommendations made. Acts in a advisory capacity on all matters pertaining to health and safety for the guidance of the employer and the workers. Conducts investigation of accidents as member of the Health and Safety Committee and submits his separate report and analysis of accidents to the employer. Coordinates all health and safety training programs for the employees and employer. Conducts health and safety inspection as member of the committee. Maintains or helps in the maintenance of an efficient accident record system and coordinates actions taken by supervisors to eliminate accident causes. Provides assistance to government agencies in the conduct of safety and health inspection, accident investigation or any other related programs. Requirements: MUST be BOSH Certified Willing to be assigned either at Parañaque or Alabang

Scope and Responsibilities Ensure a safe workplace environment without risk to health Ensure that all Health & Safety policies, procedures, rules and regulations are adhered to and are regularly reviewed, updated and communicated Ensure the company meets its statutory obligations in all areas pertaining to health, safety and welfare at work, including statutory training and reporting Ensure the completion and regular review of risk assessments for all work equipment and operations Ensure that safety inspections are carried out, fire drills and fire alarms are correctly reported, earthquake drills are being implemented, safety inspections, risk assessments and lone working procedures are managed and employees are aware of their responsibilities Ensure full and accurate health and safety and training records are maintained Establish a structured program of health & safety training throughout the company Perform safety audits and inspect facilities, machinery, and equipment to identify and correct potential hazards, and to ensure safety regulation compliance Assessing risk and possible safety hazards of all aspects of operations. May collect and analyze potentially hazardous materials, and train workers who handle the hazardous materials Auditing production, keeping on the lookout for any unsafe behavior or breaks in regulations Inspecting production equipment and processes to make sure they are safe. Must conduct testing of equipment and other tools to ensure that it meets regulatory guidelines and train workers on the safe method to operate any piece of equipment Ordering repairs for unsafe and/or damage equipment Focusing on prevention by keeping up with equipment maintenance and training of employee/staff and on-site workers for emergency procedures Participating in continuing education to update knowledge of health and safety protocols and techniques Creating safety plans that include suggested improvements to existing infrastructure and business processes Investigating causes of accidents and other unsafe conditions on the job site and finding the best way to prevent future accidents Reviewing and reporting on the staff’s compliance with health and safety rules and recommending commendations or dismissal based on performance Makes sure safety gear is available to all employees and that they wear it on the job Liaising with law enforcement and other investigators who are present at the time of a serious accident Creating analytical reports of safety data Salary is negotiable base on exeperience Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s/College Degree in Engineering (Environment/Health/Safety) or equivalent Knowledgeable in Occupational Safety and Health Standards Knowledge of potentially hazardous materials or practices Diligent with great attention to detail Excellent communication skills with the ability to present and explain health and safety topics

Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree , Engineering (Mechanical), Engineering (Petroleum/Oil/Gas) or equivalent. At least 4 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Preferably Supervisor / 5 Yrs & Up Experienced Employees specializing in Engineering - Environmental/Health/Safety or equivalent. With at least 2 years of experience in petroleum industry. Full-Time position(s) available. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES HEALTH, ENVIRONMENT. SAFETY • Conduct safety training and orientation to employees, guests and visitors • Implement and maintain safety programs, policies and procedures to ensure good health and safe practices • Conduct job hazard analysis and risk assessment to work related processes of the company • Monitors and maintain an updated emergency preparedness plan. Assist Emergency Response Team during emergency situations. • Ensure that the emergency equipment (oil spill and firefighting equipment) are ready and effectively maintained to control loss during emergencies. • Creates awareness among the employees and heighten the consciousness about safety, good housekeeping and environmental • Record accident occurrence and formulation of corrective actions to prevent recurrence • Prepares safety statistical information as basis for the safety performance of the facility FACILITY MAINTENANCE• Oversee terminal maintenance. This includes repair on the terminal facilities and equipment such as PD pumps, motors, valves, loading arms, HVAC, firefighting system, piping system etc.• Identify and recommend replacement or upgrade of terminal facilities and equipment• Prepare proposals, technical evaluation, recommendations and submit Purchase Requisitions• Ensure that the implementation of PM is carried out based on the scheduled and detailed tasks• Ensure that the documentation is in place for effective maintenance history monitoring and improvement reference.• Assist on the facility inspection, safety audit and training requirement• Monitor, review and inspect HESS related project development SECURITY • Ensure that the security operations are within the bound of the company security manual • Monitors security agency compliance to the immediate reportorial of incidences of their respective locations

Responsible for monitoring and assessing hazardous and unsafe situations within the premises of the company. They develop measures to assure employees safety. Correct unsafe acts or conditions through the regular line of authority. May exercise emergency authority to prevent or stop unsafe acts when immediate action is required. Coordinates will all UNAHCO Safety Officers (SO) assigned in all Offices and Plants Nationwide. Coordinates with UNILAB Safety Department for mandatory requirements and updates from UNILAB INC. Coordinates with DOLE and other government agencies related to function for compliance. Ensure that the company is compliant to all occupational health and safety (OHS) guidelines by DOLE. Conducts inspection of work sites and review working conditions. Develop and implement OHS training programs for the company and concerned personnel. Monitors and assess hazardous and unsafe situation within the premises. Ensures that all processes are safe and comply with OHS guidelines and ensures that unsafe processes are not repeated. Oversee proper disposal of substances according to environmental standards. Ensures that statues, regulations and codes are clearly understood and met by the company and its employees. Ensure all personnel follow all personal safety precautions. Update procedures and policies for new regulations or local ordinances regarding occupational safety and health. Participate in planning meetings to identify any health and safety concerns inherent in the operations of the company. Trains and carries out drills and exercises on how to manage emergency situations. Other duties assigned from time to time Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree, Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam) in Engineering (Chemical), Engineering (Electrical/Electronic), Engineering (Industrial), Engineering (Mechanical) or equivalent. No work experience required. Required Skill(s): Knowledge of good safety practices, Developing emergency procedures, Ability to work on own initiative, Physically fit and able to walk around for long periods of time, Able to work collaboratively in a team setting Preferably Less than 1 year experience specialized in Others/Category not available or equivalent.

Scope and Responsibilities Being a Health and Safety Supervisor investigates, analyzes, and reports on any accidents or unsafe events and suggests remedial and preventative actions.Develops a safety conscious culture by providing workforce education on first aid, emergency/safety procedures and regulations.A safety supervisor inspects workplaces and directs employees to ensure that people and property are kept safe at all times.Safety supervisors regularly visit facilities to enforce legal regulations and help establish more effective procedures. In order to work as a safety supervisor, an individual is usually required to possess strong problem-solving, writing, and verbal communication skills.Oversee the work performed by laborers to make sure they are following legal and company safety guidelines.Inspects equipment, tools, and building materials to ensure quality and safety.Supervisors in manufacturing plants make sure that machinery is properly maintained and that workers wear appropriate safety gear, such as helmets and goggles, at all times.They tour facilities to inspect equipment and processes. A safety supervisor is authorized to issue warnings or fines when he or she discovers violations of safety codes. When violations are discovered, the supervisor explains problems to employees and managers and informs them how they can bring their establishment back up to code.Other duties as required. Qualifications and Requirements: Experience as an office assistant or in related field.Ability to write clearly and help with word processing when necessary.Warm personality with strong communication skills.Ability to work well under limited supervision.Great communication skills.Salary is negotiable based on experience.

Scope and Responsibilities Ensure a safe workplace environment without risk to health.Ensure that all Health & Safety policies, procedures, rules and regulations are adhered to and are regularly reviewed, updated and communicated.Ensure the company meets its statutory obligations in all areas pertaining to health, safety and welfare at work, including statutory training and reporting.Ensure the completion and regular review of risk assessments for all work equipment and operations.Ensure that safety inspections are carried out, fire drills and fire alarms are correctly reported, earthquake drills are being implemented, safety inspections, risk assessments and lone working procedures are managed and employees are aware of their responsibilities.Ensure full and accurate health and safety and training records are maintained .Establish a structured program of health & safety training throughout the company.Perform safety audits and inspect facilities, machinery, and equipment to identify and correct potential hazards, and to ensure safety regulation compliance.Assessing risk and possible safety hazards of all aspects of operations. May collect and analyze potentially hazardous materials, and train workers who handle the hazardous materials.Auditing production, keeping on the lookout for any unsafe behavior or breaks in regulations.Inspecting production equipment and processes to make sure they are safe. Must conduct testing of equipment and other tools to ensure that it meets regulatory guidelines and train workers on the safe method to operate any piece of equipment.Ordering repairs for unsafe and/or damage equipment.Reviewing and reporting on the staff’s compliance with health and safety rules and recommending commendations or dismissal based on performance.Creating safety plans that include suggested improvements to existing infrastructure and business processes.Investigating causes of accidents and other unsafe conditions on the job site and finding the best way to prevent future accidents.Liaising with law enforcement and other investigators who are present at the time of a serious accident.Perform other task, duties and responsibilities. Qualifications and Requirements: Experience as an office assistant or in related field.Ability to write clearly and help with word processing when necessary.Warm personality with strong communication skills.Ability to work well under limited supervision.Great communication skills.Salary is negotiable based on experience.

JOB DESCRIPTION: Attends to the requirements of the company prior to the construction or installation of pollution control facilities including the application and securing of necessary pollution permits and renewal. Monitor activities pertaining the installation or construction of pollution source and control facilities with the end in view of ensuring compliance with air, noise and water quality standards; Supervise the proper operation and maintenance and pollution control facilities of the establishment or agency. Reports within reasonable time to the authority the breakdown of any pollution control facility, and the estimated and actual date of completion/repair and operation. Keep himself abreast with the requirements of the authority and the latest available technology on prevention, control and abatement of pollution Maintain liaison with the city/provincial/municipal or local pollution control officers Attend the meetings for Pollution Control Officers which may from time to time be called the authority Facilitate compliance of the company he represents with the requirements that may from time to time prescribed by the authority Recommend to the management the installation and operation of additional equipment for pollution abatement facilities. JOB QUALIFICATIONS: Candidate must possess a Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering or any equivalent course. With Basic PCO Training Course by an EMB-recognized training organization within the last three (3) years. Atleast with Basic Safety Officer Training and First Aid and Basic Life Support Training. Must be proficient in Microsoft Office applications, particularly in Excel and Powerpoint. Must exhibit good communication and presentation skills. Must be organized and possesses a good sense of time management and attention to detail. With at least one (1) year related work experience preferably in an automotive industry. PREFERABLY RESIDING NEAR PILILLA, RIZAL

Junior Product Engineer – Supply Chain Practice JOB DESCRIPTION As a Jr. Engineer – Product Compliance, this is your unique opportunity to set your mark on the leading-edge. Anthesis is recruiting for full time positions to collect, evaluate, validate and manage engineering/technical/parametric data and information in SAP and other client and Anthesis engineering/compliance systems. To be successful, familiarity with technical data and product/part/material composition will be desirable. We are looking for entry level resources who are self-starters and willing to learn. HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE: Following are lists of responsibilities but these are not exhaustive. Other responsibilities may be assigned depending on the needs of projects. Primary Responsibilities: • Review, validate and process engineering documents for mechanical, electronics and electrical products according to defined protocols; • Collect/validate/manage data related to product/environmental compliance; • Track progress/performance and provide periodic metrics reports; • Use product engineering/technical documents or parametric data for various client/customers’ needs; • Normal work hours will be first (day) shift but you may be asked to work on another shift as the needs of a project demand. REQUIREMENTS - WHAT YOU NEED TO QUALIFY • Excellent command of both spoken and written English • Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering (Chemical/Materials/Electrical/Electronics), Chemistry or equivalent. • Parametric Data, Technical Drawings/Datasheets • Knowledge in Product Compliance, Full Material Disclosure (FMD) Data, Material Safety Datasheet (MSDS), Technical Data Sheets (TDS) • Strong Computer proficiency with MS Office and good understanding of software tools • Good communication, good team player, and interpersonal skills • Self-organized, self-motivated, detail-oriented, meticulous and with strong sense of responsibility for quality and able to work independently under pressure • Ability to troubleshoot and analyze complex problems. Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines. • Occasional travel may be required for meeting with regulatory agencies, trade group associations, and customers. • The successful candidate must report to work Pasig City. • Shifting may be required. Preferred: • Chinese and/or Japanese spoken and written technical language capability will be an advantage • Preferably 1 Year Experienced Employees specializing in Engineering – Chemical/Materials/Electrical/Electronics or equivalent. • Knowledge of electronics/electrical manufacturing, bills of materials (BoMs), and materials typically used in electrical/electronics manufacturing • Experience in SAP

About the role Contract type: Permanent, full-time Start date: ASAP Location: National Capital Region, Philippines Reporting to: Head of the Phillipines/Singapore - Remote working . Salary: Dependent on qualifications and experience What you’ll be doing Key Responsibilities Work with key water industry clients (utilities, contractors, etc.) to understand their needs, drivers and technology requirements; Design and execute complex consultancy projects to meet these needs using available tools; Help to identify, research and evaluate (from a technical and commercial perspective) new and existing technologies, products and services from companies all over the world; Build strong relationships with clients and partners to secure their involvement in innovation programs; Liaise directly with Isle colleagues in other territories such as Singapore, Australia, UK and US. Consulting Build robust relationships with technology companies – this may include consultancy-based work or a more formal strategic relationship; Identify and develop technology-based collaborative trials in water companies; Strengthen on-going working relationships with key stakeholders. Budget Management (optional) Good commercial acumen and ability to: Support with budgeting and forecasting; Invoice and secure timely cash collections; What the role requires Qualifications: Technical or scientific degree. (Chemical or Environmental Engineering) A postgraduate degree and/or evidence of continuing study is favourable Experience with innovation, consulting and water technology experience is highly desirable. Membership of an appropriate professional body would also be desirable. Required language(s): English At least 3 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Required Skill(s): Microsoft Office, Microsoft Project Preferably Supervisor/5 Yrs & Up Experienced Employee specialized in Engineering - Environmental/Health/Safety or equivalent. Knowledge/Experience: Philippine water industry experience International water sector experience is desirable Analysis of data and technical information Writing proposals and high-quality technical reports Project management and delivery Technical Skills/Ability: Motivated self-starter with the ability to work autonomously. Innovator and creative thinker with good communication skills. Technical specialism in water or wastewater treatment Completer-finisher Confident to engage / network with a diverse client base The key selling point for the Job 1) Competitive salary, 2) Remote working arrangement (Beat the Manila Traffic) - Work from home 3) Innovative work culture 4) International exposure 5) Make an impact and a difference to the environment 6) Make the world a better place!! For more info: https://www.isleutilities.com/

QUALIFICATIONS Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree , Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam), Engineering (Environmental/Health/Safety) or equivalent. With at least three (3) years related work experience preferably in the aggregates/mining industry sector. Must be a DENR-accredited PCO (Pollution Control Officer) Must be DOLE-accredited Safety Officer With strong and dynamic personality and excellent leadership and communication skills. Able to solve problems and troubleshoot as the need arises Exceptional written and verbal communication Skills With strong personality and sense of responsibility Willing to work in DRT Bulacan RESPONSIBILITIES Responsible for monitoring, preparation and compliance of reports and permits from government agencies such as DENR Supervise the proper operation and maintenance of pollution control facilities of the company; Maintain liaison with the city/provincial/municipal or local pollution control officers; Ensure compliance with the requirements of PD1586, RA6969, RA8749, RA9003, RA9275 and their respective implementing rules and regulations, and other pertinent rules and regulations; Ensures compliance to all applicable environmental laws and occupational safety and health regulations that covers the operations of the company Promptly submit Self Monitoring Reports (SMR), duly accomplished and signed off by the PCO and Plant Engineer; Identify significant environmental aspects and impacts of the establishment’s operational activities and recommend possible mitigating measures in the formulation/preparation and/or review of the Environmental Management Plan and Contingency Plan; Implements occupational safety and health programs in the workplace in accordance with the provisions of legal standards Conducts training forum and toolbox talk, as needed, to provide instruction on specific Environmental, Safety and Health concern Ensure that employees are trained in Environmental Management Systems and Regulatory Compliance linked to their respective processes. Monitors PPE compliance and safety of plant personnel Conducts inspections, determines hazards and recommends safety and health solutions Conduct regular hazard identification risk and assessment control on the plant. Submit and Attend as a duly authorized representative of the plant when there are technical conferences, hearings, meetings and especially on matters pertaining to pollution control cases of the plant; Conduct safety orientation for newly hired employees, suppliers/contractors and visitors. Ensure monthly safety assessment and weekly inspections are being executed. Acts as site advisory in the application of health and safety programs to eliminate the hazards from workplace and correct unsafe work practices. Proper maintenance of accident records and coordinates action taken by supervisors to eliminate accident causes. Adhere and implement Company Policies, Good Housekeeping, Quality, Environmental, Health and Safety Policy and/or Program of the company.

To abreast with the requirements of the DENR-EMB and the latest available technology on the prevention, control and abatement of pollution; and To develop and implement programs to control and minimize generation of pollution; Attends to the requirements of the establishment prior to the construction or installation of pollution control facilities including the application and securing of necessary pollution permits and renewal thereof. Monitors the activities pertaining to the installation or construction of pollution source and control facilities. Supervises the proper operation and maintenance of pollution control facilities of the establishment. Reports within reasonable to the DENR-EMB the breakdown of any pollution control facility, and the estimated and actual dates of completion/ repair and operation. Promptly submits validated/ certified correct periodic reports to the DENR-EMB. Attends meeting for Pollution Control Officers which may be called by the DENR-EMB. Facilitates compliance of the establishment to the requirements as prescribed by the DENR-EMB. Responsible in preparation of periodic reports and renewal of permits to DENR-EMB and other government regulatory agencies. Job Qualifications Must be a graduate BS in Electrical Engineering; Must be PCO Certified; Must have atleast 2 years experience in an Industrial/Manufacturing environment; Must be willing to learn, keen attention to details and result-oriented; Candidate must be willing to be assigned to Calinan, Davao City.

Job Qualifications: A bachelor’s degree or an associate degree. Valid competency certificates. Registration as a Health and Safety Officer. Strong communication skills. Responsibilities: Compile safety programs. Practice safe working techniques. Implement and maintain health and safety standards. Establish a cordial and professional relationship with employees. Maintain compliance with all safety regulations.

Company: LIGHT AND HOPE OVERSEAS PLACEMENT AGENCY
Job Description: Auditing production, keeping on the lookout for any unsafe behaviour or breaks in regulations Assessing risk and possible safety hazards of all aspects of operations Inspecting production equipment and processes to make sure they are safe Qualifications: Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree , Others or equivalent. At least 2 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Applicants must be willing to work in Jeddah,Makkah Region. 10 Full-Time position(s) available. Principal / Employer : ENTOTOX KSA Principal / Employer Address : SAUDI JEDDAH Placement Fee : Please be reminded that as per POEA regulations, the placement fee is up to a maximum of one (1) month's salary. For interested applicants please click “APPLY NOW” and be sure to upload your updated CV or resume through Jobstreet.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES -Observes and complies with existing company codes, policies, agreements, rules and regulations. -Conduct regular inspection of buildings, facilities, work areas, tools and equipment of the company; -Observes work methods and procedures of workers to determine unsafe working conditions and practices. -Assist and investigates accidents by spot inspection and interrogation of parties and/or witnesses involved to determine cause and prevent recurrence of the same. -Prepares reports based on inspection, observation and investigation; recommending measures and methods of eliminating unsafe working conditions and procedures. -Conducts periodic seminars and trainings through field demonstrations and/or lectures on safety practices, accidents prevention measures and defensive driving techniques. -Coordinates to SHE Department (Home-Office) applicant drivers and company employees seeking authority to drive and operate company vehicles to determine driving proficiency. -Orient newly hired employees on safety, rules, regulations and practices. -Attends and/or participates on regular meeting within and outside of the company, -Serves as the secretary on the SHE & S Committee and prepares minutes of the meeting. -Participates on the research studies on matters involving safety and recommends measures and procedures and procedures to prevent or eliminate unsafe working conditions and procedures. -Monitors proper housekeeping and cleaning of the work are including furniture, tools and equipment, vehicles, supplies, etc. -Practices and monitors safety rules and regulations in the work area. -Inspects fire distinguisher periodically and prepares report. -Fulfils all the duties and responsibilities of a Safety Officer as per DOLE OSH Standard Rules No. 1030 and 1040. -Performs other functions as may be assigned by SHE-Head relating to Safety Control. JOB SPECIFICATIONS A. Education/Knowledge: -College Degree in Engineering or any related course of Safety, Health and Environment. -Knowledgeable with the Occupational Safety and Health Standards -Completed the training course on BOSH/COSH (Basic Occupational Safety and Health / Construction Occupational Safety & Health). -DOLE Accredited OSH Practitioner an Advantage. B. Skills: -Computer, typing, communication, safety auditing/ training and driving. C. Job brief We are looking for a responsible Safety Officer to facilitate compliance with occupational health and safety (OHS) guidelines. You will provide advice on measures to minimize hazards or unhealthy situations. You will also be on a constant lookout for violations. The ideal candidate will be a responsible individual who swears by OSH regulations. Your work will be largely focused on prevention so you need to be conscientious and farsighted. The ideal candidate will also be detail-oriented and ready to act in emergencies. The goal is to establish a safe workplace according to legal standards and foster a culture of attention to health and safety. Responsibilities Support the development of OHS policies and programs Advise and instruct on various safety-related topics (noise levels, use of machinery etc.) Conduct risk assessment and enforce preventative measures Review existing policies and measures and update according to legislation Initiate and organize OHS training of employees and executives Inspect premises and the work of personnel to identify issues or non-conformity (e.g. not using protective equipment) Oversee installations, maintenance, disposal of substances etc. Stop any unsafe acts or processes that seem dangerous or unhealthy Record and investigate incidents to determine causes and handle worker’s compensation claims Prepare reports on occurrences and provide statistical information to upper management Requirements Proven experience as safety officer In depth knowledge of legislation (e.g. OSHA/EPA) and procedures Knowledge of potentially hazardous materials or practices Experience in writing reports and policies for health and safety Familiarity with conducting data analysis and reporting statistics Proficient in MS Office; Working knowledge of safety management information systems is a plus Outstanding organizational skills Diligent with great attention to detail Excellent communication skills with the ability to present and explain health and safety topics BSc/BA in safety management, engineering or relevant field is preferred Certificate in occupational health and safety

Job Qualifications: Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in any field. At least 1-2 Years of working experience as a First Aider is required for this position. Preferably 1-4 Yrs Experienced Employee specialized in Clerical/Administrative Support, Healthcare or equivalent. With background and specialization on basic caregiving skills such as first aid, rapid testing, taking blood pressure, etc. Must provide valid certifications such as issued by RED CROSS, related to First Aid. Has also an experience with Admin or Clerical works Computer literate Willing to be assigned in KAWIT CAVITE and other job sites when needed PROJECT BASED DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Provide immediate, lifesaving, medical care before the arrival of further medical help. This could include performing procedures such as: Placing an unconscious casualty into the recovery position Performing Cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) Stopping bleeding using pressure and elevation Keeping a fractured limb still To preserve life and prevent the worsening of the patient’s condition and to promote recovery. Manage the incident and ensure the continuing safety of themselves, bystanders and the casualty Assess casualties and find out the nature & cause of their injuries Arrange for further medical help or other emergency services to attend (e.g: the fire service) Provide appropriate first aid treatment as trained If able, make notes/observations of casualties Provide a handover when further medical help arrives Performs other related tasks that maybe assigned from time to time.

Bachelor's/College Degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Environmental Planning Basic Pollution Control officer Training, PRC Registered/Licensed is advantage At least 5 Year(s) of working experience in environmental monitoring Role Purpose: Develop, implement, and monitor effective chemical management (CM), hazardous waste management (HWM), and solid waste management (SWM) programs;Investigate the nature and extent of soil, sediment, groundwater, and other media contamination;Implement and monitor environmental initiatives to promote strong stakeholder engagement and create a positive image for the Organization;Assist environmental regulatory agency site visits and audits;Assist PCO on managing the environmental impacts associated with construction, operations, and rehabilitation of the Project by: providing expertise on ensuring compliance to all local environmental regulations, andproviding recommendations to ensure continued effective and efficient operations of Materials Recovery Facility (MRF) and Hazardous Waste Facility (HWF);develop plans to prevent, control, or solve environmental problems; Coordinate with other Departments in the implementation of the Organization’s environmental directives;Generate timely reports with accurate data of the Organization’s environmental performance and innovations on chemicals and wastes;Assist in environmental permit applications and permit renewals in relation to chemicals and wastes;Conduct environmental training for employees at all levels;Act the role of Environment Officer for Air, Water, & Ambient during the latter’s field break / out of office;Perform other tasks that maybe assigned from time to time

· Must have at least Bachelor’s Degree in related field · Must have at least 10 years total work experience, and 6 years’ experience in similar field, preferably in railways, elevated structures or bridges, and accredited by DOLE on Construction Site Safety/Construction Occupational Safety and Health (COSH). · Able to establish Site Safety Plan according to Employer’s standard, and safety management in compliance with Occupational Health and Safety Regulations and other related Philippine national and local standards / requirements. · Support the development of Occupational health and safety (OHS) policies and programs. · Advise and instruct on various safety-related topics (noise levels, use of machinery etc.) · Inspect premises and the work of personnel to identify issues or non-conformity (e.g. not using protective equipment). · Initiate and organize OHS training of employees and executives. · Conduct risk assessment and enforce preventative measures. · Knowledgeable in site emergency response and rescue procedure. · Prepare occurrence/incident reports and provide statistical information to upper management

The Corporate Security Manager oversees and coordinates all efforts across SkyCable and all its affiliate companies nationwide to promote Security. He assists the Head, Corporate Security and Safety in the formulation of corporate-wide Security policies, regulations and procedures and is responsible for the smooth and effective implementation of such policies, regulations and procedures; develops and implements approved Security programs, projects and other related activities; conducts periodic reviews of Security regulations and procedures and recommends changes or revisions to the same as may be found necessary. Responsibilities: Organize, train, develop, oversee and coordinate a network of Security officers, coordinators, consultants and Security services providers across SkyCable units and all affiliates nationwide with functions dedicated to the promotion of Security in the workplace and the Security of employees and visitors. Implement corporate-wide Security policy, standards, guidelines and procedures to ensure the establishment and maintenance of a secure work environment. Review and approve the following Security procedures as prepared by the Security Supervisor: post order of all guard posts access control procedures to include visitor management property control procedures keys management and control procedures bomb threat contingency threat and suspicious calls management procedures Develop and maintain good rapport with local and national government regulatory agencies in areas covered by operations of SkyCable units and affiliates nationwide. Assist the Head, Corporate Security and Safety in the formulation of Security incident response plans as well as in the implementation of the same and the investigation of Security violations, and pursuing disciplinary processes associated with such violations as may be found necessary. Conduct Security risk assessments, surveys and audits of SkyCable units and affiliates as directed by the Head, Corporate Security and Safety. Assist the Head, Corporate Security and Safety in Security program formulation and implementation. ·Formulate fire emergency plans and organize and train personnel on such plan at every SkyCable unit and affiliate nationwide. Conduct studies and submit recommendations for the acquisition, expansion and/or upgrade of Security equipment. Formulate and review periodically Security manual for SkyCable units and all affiliates nationwide for consideration and approval by the Head, Corporate Security and Safety. Conducts investigations of Security-related incidents as directed by the Head, Corporate Security and Safety. Conducts Security orientation and training to newly hired Employee and Security induction activities to Third Party Agency. Performs other related duties as directed by the Head, Corporate Security and Safety. Qualifications: A Bachelor's/College Degree in any field. With at least 5 years of working experience in the related field is required for this position

The Corporate Safety Manager oversees and coordinates all efforts across SkyCable and all its affiliate companies nationwide to promote safety. He assists the Head, Corporate Security and Safety in the formulation of corporate-wide safety policies, regulations and procedures and is responsible for the smooth and effective implementation of such policies, regulations and procedures; develops and implements approved safety programs, projects and other related activities; conducts periodic reviews of safety regulations and procedures and recommends changes or revisions to the same as may be found necessary. Responsibilities: Organize, train, develop, oversee and coordinate a network of safety officers, coordinators, consultants and safety services providers across SkyCable units and all affiliates nationwide with functions dedicated to the promotion of safety in the workplace and the safety of employees and visitors. Implements corporate-wide safety policy, standards, guidelines and procedures to ensure the establishment and maintenance of a safe work environment. Organize and maintain an efficient, reliable and credible safety emergency response capability at every SkyCable unit and affiliate nationwide. Develops and maintain good rapport with local and national government regulatory agencies in areas covered by operations of SkyCable units and affiliates nationwide. Assist the Head, Corporate Security and Safety in the formulation of safety incident response plans as well as in the implementation of the same and the investigation of safety violations, and pursuing disciplinary processes associated with such violations as may be found necessary. Conduct safety risk assessments, surveys and audits of SkyCable units and affiliates as directed by the Head, Corporate Security and Safety. Assist the Head, Corporate Security and Safety in safety program formulation and implementation. Reporting to the Site EHS Manager, the Environmental, Health, and Safety Compliance Engineer develops, implements, and communicates the EHS programs applicable to the company which are aligned with the corporate EHS programs and regulatory bodies.
