Candidate must be a licensed Engineer and possesses certifications relevant to health and safety (e.g. BOSH, COSH, LCM, SPA, TOT) Must be an accredited DOLE Occupational Health and Safety Consultant (SO4), a certified first aider /BLS-CPR by the Red Cross, BFP, DOH, and/or TESDA With at least ten (10) years of work-related experience in a similar capacity, preferably gained in the manufacturing, power, and/or construction industry Knowledgeable in environmental and occupational health system management, ISO standards (ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001) Computer savvy, possesses above average communication and presentation skills Proactive, flexible, passionate, trustworthy, hardworking and hands-on

In- charge of the overall programs, initiatives and all issues and concerns related to Occupational, Safety and Health of the organization. Conduct risks assessment and evaluation. Performs safety audits. Ensures organizational compliance to OSH standards. Initiates programs and initiatives in accordance with the provisions of OHS standards. Insure timely submission compliance report to DOLE and other related agency (s). Performs Incident / Accident investigation. Conducts safety orientation to all personnel as schedule. Conducts safety training to all personnel as needed. Other tasks that maybe assigned by the Immediate Supervisor.

Job Roles and Responsibilities Operate according to the annual work plan In the field of training, activities, legal documents, and others in conjunction with the master plan Take care of workplace behavior and communicate and remind about the risk of causing accidents from work to employees in the area of responsibility (Safety Talk). To collect statistical data of illegal reports. Prevent the occurrence of such problems And report to the relevant team Take care of the safety equipment of the building in the operation Safety equipment of employees in the area responsible for accidents or unusual events that may cause accidents. Coordinate with relevant persons on the determination of time, place, and number of employees (by position, job type, and unit) in the legal training course. As well as coordinating with other external agencies in the event of an external training organization Organize and train employees in occupational safety, health, and environment courses according to Article 16, including staff training in content related to security measures and loss prevention. Follow the work environment inspection plan Make a plan of measurement points Calculate the measurement value And prepare a report to inspect the working environment, such as light, sound, heat, according to the operating area and other units under the responsibility. Submit the report of the name of appointment and other reports as required by law to the government Including clarifying on documents or other matters When there is an order document to notify the government agency on matters related to the law on safety, occupational health, and working environment of the company Conduct an investigation when receiving reports from the local work accident and local authorities. Including preparing an investigation report Analyze the cause Presenting preventive or corrective measures to the agency And follow up on corrective action to prevent repeated accidents Inspect, control, and advise employees on how to comply with occupational safety manuals and regulations. Check the safety of the equipment Warning / Forced / Prohibited Sign And other circumstances Including the behavior of local employees and other agencies under their responsibility (Safety Patrol) Conduct a monthly meeting of the safety committee at work (NCPO) Along with preparing minutes of the meeting for use as evidence in accordance with the law Organize and support an annual fire evacuation drill in accordance with the law in the area of responsibility. Supervise the work of security personnel (security guards) in the area responsible for compliance with the standard of operation (SOP). Conduct investigations into employees of disciplinary or serious offenses in conjunction with HR, HRBP, and ER when fraud or loss occurs in order to find the perpetrator. Along with preparing a report summarizing the investigation and representing the prosecution of employees. Randomly tested employees for drugs and alcohol according to the cycle prescribed in accordance with the law. Including inspecting employees with suspicious characteristics Responsible for drug prevention, crime, and illegal goods in the area responsible for Support other tasks assigned by supervisors or companies. Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Department of Occupational Health and Safety (Occupational and Safety) or Safety Engineering (Safety Engineering) and can be registered as a professional safety officer. Professional Experience: At least 2 years of experience in a related field At least 1-year experience in security, investigation, and legal proceedings Knowledge of the standard of duty of the safety officer at the professional level according to the law. Knowledge of the laws related to delinquency, corruption, drugs, and illegal activities. Others: · Able to drive a car and have a driving license · Able to travel to work outside the office or upcountry according to the assigned job.

About the Opportunity: As an Environment Consultant, you’ll oversee the installation and maintenance of Water Waste Treatment Facility (WWTF) of McDonald’s restaurants market-wide, to ensure compliance in local regulations and ordinances. Get to work closely with the operations in conducting restaurant audits and trainings! You will handle excavation permits and validate Discharge Permit (DP) application, including processing of job orders with key stakeholders The role is highly cross-functional and entails working with various internal and external partners (government offices, agencies, suppliers) from monitoring, settling and executing projects and agreements. You must have deep knowledge or interest in water systems, environmental sustainability and public health welfare. About the department: You’ll be part of a lean but integral and vital team which ensures top-notch safety and quality of service. The team is always on the go in providing all-out service to improve the entire company’s ability to function efficiently and effectively.

POSITION: HEALTH, SAFETY AND ENVIRONMENT (HSE) MANAGER FEEDS COMPANY LOCATED IN GERONA, TARLAC. JOB DESCRIPTION: 1. Lead and work with plant managers to ensure compliance of local laws, rules and regulationson HSE.2. Establish and maintain corporate standards, procedures and requirements according to HSEpolicy and manual.3. Drives effective implementations of HSE requirements in the plant. 4. Drive and execute the continuous improvement approach including audit, Gap analysis, self-assessment and inspection. 5. Direct and work with local plant management to develop factory HSE action plans. Definebudgets to achieve established HSE objectives.6. Set up an alert system to report, notify, communicate and follow main HSE issues at grouplevel.7. Provide necessary trainings to HSE team and employees. QUALIFICATIONS: 1. Bachelor's degree in Engineering, HSE Management, FoodScience, Bio-technology, or Chemistry.2. Minimum of 5-7 years relevant working experience as HSE manager inindustries with productions in Aquaculture, Animal Nutrition, Agriculture,Chemical, Food processing, Pharmaceutical, etc.3. Strong knowledge of HSE laws and regulations, and internationalcertifications IS14001 and ISO45001.4. Preferably a Certified Safety Professional – )SO45. Strong communication and people management skills in workingenvironment with diversified cultures.6. Working experience in matrix organization.7. Proficient in the English Language8. Preferably a Certified Environment Professional in Scheduled WasteManagement.
